0.name: Totally Toronto Art
0.formatted_address: 1 Scott St #2904, Toronto, ON M5E 1A1, Canada
reviews: Ordering three throw pillows of Toronto neighbourhoods was easy and straightforward. I was very pleased with the great service I received from Pam in making sure that my deliveries were fast and efficient. I was delightfully surprised to find David’s exceptional art on both sides of the pillows. I’m impressed with the high quality of the poly-linen fabric as well as the vibrant, rich colours. I am a proud supporter of items made in Canada and can’t wait to give one of these pillows as a gift this Christmas. Sure to be a conversation opener.

Thank you for the excellent quality products, fast delivery and fantastic selection of David Crighton’s art. There are so many great gift ideas on the website. We decided to get ten postcards to frame and mount on our wall of all of our favourite places, neighbourhoods and landmarks in Toronto that are meaningful to us. Each piece tells our story and we just love it. We will definitely order from Totally Toronto Art again!

I have purchased art from David since 1994 and share my purchases with friends from out of country who have visited Toronto. Puzzles, calendars, cards, postcards, posters are all of the finest quality and I am never disappointed in the beautiful detail David puts into every image. I am looking forward to a new piece depicting the renovated Massey Hall when  it is finished in a couple of years!

I'm  very pleased with all the David Crighton products I've received,  posters, postcards, greeting cards and pillows.  The quality is excellent and the colours are so vibrant.  The customer service is also excellent.  David Crighton has produced pillows depicting a wide variety of U. S. landmarks.  They, as well as all other products I've ordered, display  beautiful , vibrant artwork reproduced on high quality materials.

My first purchase was a wedding gift for my nephew in 1997...As he was being transfered to the USA... I presented him with the ' My Toronto '  framed. Since then I have purchased  calendars several years.. mugs.. cards.. ' My Toronto ' pouch and Tote Bag. Most have been gifts . but I still have my eye on many other items... I want for myself the ' My Toronto  '  Poster... wish I could manage the framed one but the poster one will be just as cherished. I will continue to give David's incredible unique items as gifts in the future. As well I continue to spread the word. So many to choose from... love them all!!!

1.name: The Power Plant Contemporary Art Gallery
1.formatted_address: 231 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2G8, Canada
reviews: Had an incredible time experiencing the Power Plant's Summer 2022 Exhibition Season! The Mixed media Artworks by Hiwa K in particular were very moving and, eye-opening. Thanks to places like this Contemporary Art Galleries we get glimpses of so much that is beyond our general awareness.

I love coming down here to see the exhibits. It's free and accessible. All located on ground level, you can see fantastic artwork inside and outside. They often rotate, so check online for what is on exhibit.  It's also close to the Harbourfront. You can hit two birds with one stone.  I recommend you come if you can.
I haven't been in the Harbourfront fro a while and I had the impression it is a new art gallery. Crowded because of the Nuit Blanche event.
Small but cool contemporary gallery. Cool to give it a visit as you walk along the waterfront. The entrance is free as well.
We stumbled upon the art gallery by accident & the exhibits were quite different from what I expected. Yet it was eye-opening by works of Hiva K, Paulo Nazareth.

editorial_summary.overview: Industrial-style art gallery featuring avant-garde works, along with an array of programs & events.

2.name: Bay of Spirits Gallery
2.formatted_address: 334 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5T 1G5, Canada
reviews: Absolutely wonderful experience here! Such a variety of unique pieces, I could spend hours in this gallery. Staff were polite and helpful when I had questions but were not overbearing. I was able to browse peacefully and enjoy all the artwork. I would highly recommend this gallery if you are looking for Canadian art and sculptures!!
The best First Nations gallery in the city. The gallery has a great range of work and the staff are always super knowledgeable and approachable! Love the new location.

One of the finest places in the city to find First Nations art. The art represents cultures all over Canada with everything from undiscovered artists to the well established. Works you'll fall in love with in sculpture, paint, jewelry, and more. My personal favourite is Jay Bell Redbird's work, dramatic and full of meaning.
The art at Bay is so gorgeous! Such a lovely environment run by a wonderful family. Always recommend and I will be a forever customer.
We have bought several pieces from this gallery.  The staff are very professional and knowledgeable.   We are running out of qall space but we always find room for one more.

3.name: Preservation House
3.formatted_address: 461 King St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1L6, Canada
reviews: Victor spent time & expertise restoring my mother in law's hard edged painting from the 1960's-Marjorie Mckee was part of the Abstract Expressionist in NYC and one of the last artists to exhibit at Peggy Guggenheim's gallery. Thank you for restoring our family art work.
This is my go to place for careful repairs to old paintings. Top quality work.

4.name: Nicholas Metivier Gallery
4.formatted_address: 190 Richmond St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1P1, Canada
reviews: Our experience with Metivier has been incredibly positive. We have made several inquiries about a variety of artists over the past year, and responses were always prompt and helpful.  Caroline Pearson is thoughtful, patient, pleasant and knowledgeable.  She guided us through many emails and finally in person at the gallery.  We couldn’t be happier with our purchase of a stunning Matt Bahen canvas.
Maybe because we were "older"... Very cold reception absolutely no interest in our presence.  Unfortunately for them, two of our group are wealthy collectors...they won't be back.
An excellent contemporary gallery.
great staff always friendly no matter if you buy or not
All their artist are top notch, I am for sure buying my next painting from this place.

5.name: Harbourfront Centre Bill Boyle Artport
5.formatted_address: 235 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2G8, Canada
reviews: One of my favorite galleries in South Toronto. The exhibits are thought provoking and contemporary and the artists are usually local.
Went to the Muesum of Broken Relationships back in August. Really nice
Nice area. Getting better and better every time we go.
Beautiful
The senior technical coordinator is DREAMY

6.name: Sculptors Society of Canada
6.formatted_address: 19 Mill St, Toronto, ON M5A 3R3, Canada
reviews: This is a nice little collection of sculptures.  They rotate their pieces every few months.  It would be nice if we could take pictures of the pieces but some artists done agree to that I suppose.
Gorgeous gallery - worth checking out!!!
The lady who let us in gave us such a wonderful tour! She was so passionate about all the works, and very nice! Definitely worth visiting!
Good

7.name: The Market Gallery
7.formatted_address: 95 Front St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1C2, Canada
reviews: This small but mighty gallery is on the second floor of the iconic St Lawrence Market, and is the former home of City Hall. The exhibit on now: "Toronto through the eyes of women artists". May is "Museum  Month" in the city of Toronto, meaning that you can get into nine city of Toronto-run museums for free with your Toronto library card. Visit here and you will get a terrific view of the St Lawrence Market below.

It's a nice little gallery. They have an exhibition until April 2020 about Street Art and the organization that is behind. And it is free for this particular exhibition. I didn't know where those murals come from. It has been a discovery to know that there is a huge work from the City of Toronto and many artist not only to decorate the city but also to mentor artists at all stages of their development.
Since moving to Toronto this gallery has become one of my favourites to stop into when I am i nthe area. Nice selection of local artists...good to support our locals!!!

I visited on a field trip and was so delighted! The man who was guiding us was funny, friendly, and sarcastic. We had a blast doing the various activities prepared and visiting the historic St. Lawrence Market.

I've seen to so many great shots that have been put on here over the years, historical Toronto photos, the CNE and just before COVID, the streetArToronto exhibit. I just can't find info on who the curator is for the space.

8.name: Art Boulle
8.formatted_address: 401 Bay St. #1600, Toronto, ON M5H 2Y4, Canada
reviews: The metal work that Art Boulle did for me on two occasions was nothing short of remarkable. The quality of their work is exceptional! I highly recommend them.
Most beautiful luxurious work you will ever seen totally recommend them

9.name: Proof Studio Gallery
9.formatted_address: 15 Case Goods Lane Studio #104, Toronto, ON M5A 3C4, Canada
reviews: Reasonable rates for ethe quality of printing and framing. Very nice people to work with. All Canadian artists in the gallery.
A hidden gem of a gallery, great collection worth checking out

10.name: John A. Libby Fine Art
10.formatted_address: 463 King St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1L6, Canada

11.formatted_address: 1 Yonge St Suite 1801, Toronto, ON M5E 1W7, Canada

12.formatted_address: 1 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5E 2A3, Canada

13.name: Crosby Gallery
13.formatted_address: 176 The Esplanade, Toronto, ON M5A 4H2, Canada
reviews: I am lucky to own a few of Jennifer Crosby's original paintings. I find her work to be therapeutic for both the artist and viewer. She is a gifted poet as well. She is fearless as an artist and I'm excited to see what she'll do next. I hope to acquire more of her work!

My walls have been covered with Jennifer's art for years. From someone who started working with found pieces to throwing top selling shows within Toronto. I am super proud to see your growth and success... You always bring something new to the table while keeping that Crosby Gallery look that rest within all of your work that is completely unique on its own xoxoxo

I have the distinct advantage of being conveniently located very close to this gallery and I get to see loads of beautiful and always engaging artwork from this incredibly talented lady. I own a few pieces of her work myself and I also commissioned her to do the artwork on my album which looks SO awesome. Still a very well kept secret for some reason. She should be famous!
I own three of a series of paintings done by Jennifer.  I love my Ladies!  Have a great show.
Great artist, excellent gallery

14.name: Dish Gallery and Studio
14.formatted_address: 9 Gristmill Lane, Toronto, ON M5A 3C4, Canada
reviews: We were here for the beginners ceramics class last summer. It was a fun (albeit pricey) experience. It was however soured somewhat when a lady came in and very politely informed the owner that she was following up on some matter - the owner (who was nothing but wonderful towards us) responded very rudely/aggressively. I’m not sure of the backstory, but it didn’t look good from our viewpoints.  Our dishes turned out well, except that two of them were dyed using the wrong colours (when we mentioned this, while collecting we got a “oh yeah, that happens sometimes” response from the person who gave them to us).  We bought a few ceramic mugs here as well. They’ve lasted and are amongst my favourites.

Last year, my partner planned a ceramic workshop at the Dish Gallery and i can honestly say it was one of the best experiences anyone has ever given me as a gift.  We had the workshop to ourselves and Susan really took her time in explaining the history and process of working with ceramics.  She was patient and kind while answering all of our questions.  I loved choosing the pattern stamps, and was very happy with the product. I quickly learned that less is more in creating patterns.  As a beginner, i do not recommend expecting the items to turn out exactly how you assume they will; we were aiming for noodle bowls, but i was not strong enough to press down and create the desired depth on my first try. However, i still love and use the bowls (for fruits, yorgurt, etc). We also created small dishes that we use for soya sauce. I also use every single item for the Iranian Spring Festival/ New Year table every year.  The time seemed slightly short when we got near the end, and the price isnt exactly cheap. But definitely an experience worth investing in.  Thankn you 💙💛
They serve the coffee with the cup half full, and it is not even great coffee.

15.name: Emerging Young Artists
15.formatted_address: 14 Distillery Lane, Toronto, ON M5A 4R2, Canada
reviews: Nice art gallery. Great for new artists

16.name: Thompson Landry Gallery Cooperage Space
16.formatted_address: 6 Trinity St, Toronto, ON M5A 3C4, Canada
reviews: Stunning gallery featuring stellar artwork. Attended a work function here and it was such a great experience. Incredible ambiance, beautiful pieces - such a refreshing change from the usual humdrum off-site sessions. So glad I was introduced to the gallery, will definitely be visiting again in the future to see new works and exhibitions. Worth the trip to visit!
Beautiful ambience with amazing art works. Had a good time. I recommend people to visit this place.
Nice place to visit, look oldest town, there was lot of restaurants and bar...
Great gallery and rental venue for private events. Some challenges but overall great experience.
Love this place

17.name: Northern Expressions I Inuit Art
17.formatted_address: The Atrium, 595 Bay St., Toronto, ON M5G 2C2, Canada
reviews: Very knowledgeable staff! Beautiful artwork and gifts! I often purchase items from here if I'm looking for a meaningful gift.
Best store in Toronto! Canadian owned and at by real Aboriginal artists in the local style! Amazing customer service and the art itself is BEAUTIFUL. The staff is so knowledgeable and efficient

We give out Inuit carvings for 10 years of service with our company, and when looking for a new supplier, I found Northern Expressions via Google. After reviewing their website and seeing the large selection of carvings in various price ranges, I took a chance and ordered 3 sculptures for our upcoming BBQ where they will be handed out to the 10 year employees. I cannot say enough nice things about the service that was provided to me by the partner Olu Falope. He called to personally guarantee that i would have my packages before our event and he came in person to deliver them. They are beautifully gift wrapped with personalized cards on each for the recipients. I will be using Northern Expressions moving forward for our anniversary gifts.
Very very knowledgeable staff with great customer service. If you're looking for decor or gifts big or small, I'd be confident in Northern Expressions
Fantastic service! I've purchased art from them a  number  of times and I can always purchase with confidence

18.name: Verno Art Studios
18.formatted_address: Concourse Level, 120 Adelaide St W unit r14, Toronto, ON M5H 1P9, Canada
reviews: Love this gallery. Beautiful painting pieces and landscapes are perfect 👌 My favorite panting is here :)
Nice art gallery nice n the heart of Toronto

19.name: Follio Art Consulting
19.formatted_address: 77 Maitland Pl, Toronto, ON M4Y 2V6, Canada

20.name: Gladstone House
20.formatted_address: 1214 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1J6, Canada
reviews: Don't forget to use ʜᴏᴛᴇʟʙoʟʟʏ.ᴄᴏm when booking your resort. This web site will compare thousands of booking websites and normally will have prices much cheaper compared to others! You're welcome :)! This hotel is one of my favorites in the area. I have been staying here for a long time. If you decide to stay here you definitely will love it I'm sure!  I recently had a solo short week stay at Gladstone House. It is lovely, centrally located and full of interesting and beautiful artful touches. The bed, linens and towels are first class! Staff are welcoming, went beyond helpful and added to the fun atmosphere! Very service oriented!! I look forward to staying there again!

For the price I paid I was perfectly located next to everything needed (bars, restaurants, grocery store and public transit) and the hotel was aesthetically pleasing. However, for the price I paid, I was very displeased with housekeeping and noise level. I’ve paid way less and received fresh towels, sheets, and a made bed on a daily basis. That’s not the case here, housekeeping done a very poor job at providing quality service during my stay. Dropped off towels (not all needed) and completely skipped making the bed. When called to address the housekeeping made bed the next day with same sheets (this is with the room needs cleaning sign). While the hotel was aesthetically pleasing the shower and sink drainage were not user friendly. Elevator was not convenient unless a doorman was available, so prepare to use the stairs often.  Lastly the walls are extremely thin and you can hear everyone in the halls.  I would not recommend if comfort and relaxation is the goal. I would recommend if you can catch a deal and location is your only concern.

Nice hotel. Great concierge. Fantastic location. Horrible room placement.  There was a wedding there the night my husband and I were going to stay there. Which is totally fine. Great even. However, if they know there will be a wedding there, I have no idea why they would give people a room (who were not at the wedding) that was right OVER the party.  We could literally FEEL the music. When we called down to tell them and ask if there was another room, we were told there were no other rooms available that were not above the wedding and that the wedding was due to go until 1am.  With that, we were frantically trying to find somewhere else to stay at 11pm. Luckily we got a full refund and found a quiet hotel to stay in.  We would have loved to stay there, but it seems like a MAJOR oversight of the hotel to allow for the rooms over the wedding to be booked by people other than those who are at the wedding. On a night there is going to be a wedding there, those rooms should be strictly for guests of the wedding or the bride and groom.  If you plan on staying here, I would recommend you either request a room on the opposite side of Gladstone Ave. or ask if there is going to be a wedding on the night(s) of your stay.

For a simple night stay in the liberty village area this was adequate. The rooms are small with creative modern solutions to use the space. But all we needed was a bed and bathroom so it was more than fine. The staff were very nice and helpful, and getting checked in was easy.  However, with the bar below and common room spaces near the hotel rooms, our Saturday night sleep was constantly ruined by yelling across the hotel hallways, music, and loud groups talking; we got in around 2am to just crash and get a good night's sleep but sadly couldn't get to sleep due to the noise.  I feel if this party setup was what they were going for, they would have set up much better sound proofing so other guests could actually use the rooms to sleep.

Beautifully renovated to suit the modern lifestyle around it, the Gladstone Hotel keeps exquisite architectural parts of its past from 1889. Each floor has a lounge with different purposes (library, games room, and sitting area), and the elevator is an experience itself, exhibiting its history and durability.  Despite our room's eclectic and minimalistic design,  it was comfortable and simplistic. With the sink separate from the shower and toilet, my husband and I were able to get ready for a wedding simultaneously. Just a couple of steps from our room featured a small alcove with an Nespresso machine, dispensing hot water for tea and flavour pods, and a mini fridge (for cream!).  The staff were amiable and incredible, and extremely helpful when I encountered minor problems (that were my fault, I promise). It was also incredibly easy to check in and out after our long drive.  Thank you for a wonderful experience! I will return in the future!

editorial_summary.overview: Chic, individually decorated rooms & suites with free Wi-Fi, plus a relaxed cafe & a trendy bar.

21.name: Gallery 1313
21.formatted_address: 1313 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6K 1L8, Canada
reviews: Have always loved the exhibitions I have seen at Gallery 1313.

This is a good gallery to visit, the show changes every fortnight and presents mostly local artist ; I was able to meet some of them during the summer exhibition and it was very positive !  Here are pictures of the summer exhibition gallery and a painting by Janet Kimantas and photography from Laurie Slater.
I got to see the All Green Sculpture exhibit. Many moving pieces. It a great spot for small exhibits.
I love that there's a gallery here that has frequent exhibitions.
I have been a member of this gallery for about ten years. It provides a great exhibition space for emerging as well as veteran artists.  A well known curator recommended it to me.

22.name: Twist Gallery
22.formatted_address: 1100 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1H9, Canada
reviews: We had our wedding at Twist Gallery in July. The venue itself is stunning. It’s unique, industrial, rustic, and classy at the same time. The windows, the beams, and the changing art on the walls makes it for such a special venue. It was absolutely the best venue and the best experience we’ve had. Nadia and Emanuelle are super easy to communicate with. All of our questions and requests were answered promptly, and they help to keep you organized. The day of set up and tear down was timely and seamless. All the venue staff, the day of coordinator, the waitresses and bartenders, and food catered by Gusto were amazing. The guests kept raving about how much they loved everything. Would highly recommend for a wedding or any other event!

We are so thrilled we decided to go with Twist Gallery as our wedding venue. We only had about 5 months to pull our wedding together and Twist made it so easy to think through all the details to make our day perfect. When you sign your contract with them, you get access to a planning document which makes planning so much easier. Closer to the date, they are super responsive and helpful with every little question you may have. The actual day of went so smooth and it is very clear they have an extremely professional and organized team. Not to mention, the venue itself is unique, beautiful and will wow your guests. We got so many compliments about the venue, our guests absolutely loved it! Thank you Twist (and especially Nadia and Emanuelle) for helping to make our wedding day absolutely perfect!

We had our wedding at Twist October 2022. The venue is beautiful and everyone loved the art. Leading up to our wedding, Nadia and Emmanuelle were very helpful, answering our many emails and questions. They were very quick to respond and provided as much information as possible to make us feel comfortable leading up to our day, making the planning process very easy. The setup looked great and the venue staff were very accommodating throughout the evening. The only minor hiccup was that our ceremony reserved seating signs got lost but the staff were able to use their in-house signs instead so it did not impact the wedding. I would highly recommend Twist Gallery as a venue. Thank you Nadia, Emmanuelle & team!

Had the best wedding at Twist Gallery, the staff were so attentive from everything with the bar, photos, food, and placing all decor accordingly. Definitely consider Twist if you’re looking for a classically beautiful wedding.

Twist provided a beautiful space for our wedding. Everything went smoothly and the food was fantastic! Nadia and Em were always available throughout the planning process and made it easy for us. Compared to other downtown venues, Twist provided very good value and outstanding customer service. Lisa and Adam

The best First Nations gallery in the city. The gallery has a great range of work and the staff are always super knowledgeable and approachable! Love the new location.

The art at Bay is so gorgeous! Such a lovely environment run by a wonderful family. Always recommend and I will be a forever customer.

Highly recommend that you go check out one of your local events and support your local talent! 🥰

Great location, great artwork

40.name: SOHO Art & Custom Framing
40.formatted_address: 111 Roncesvalles Ave, Toronto, ON M6R 2K9, Canada
reviews: Came across SoHo framing on Instagram and decided to use their services for some new artwork. My experience was great both times I went into the store. Kody helped me with my framing order originally and when I went to pickup the owner helped me. She was friendly and even gave me the proper nails and hooks which I used. Very happy with the framework for my photographs and illustration piece. Would return here for any future framing.

Edit: The owner has responded to my original review with false information and an attack on my personal character. To clarify, there was never any phone communication (only by e-mail or in-person), there was never any offer to change the type of frame, there was never any offer of a refund until I requested today, and I have only ever had pleasant exchanges with the staff and sales manager (who kindly provided the refund today).  I'm honestly stunned at the level of defensiveness and dishonesty in the owner's response, but it also reinforces some of the issues I outlined in my original review. I would strongly advise against bringing your business here.  Original review: I would not bring my business here again. I ordered 2 small pieces of art to be framed in mid-July. The first piece was finished after 3 weeks, but initially not centered properly in the matting/frame (photo attached). Instead of acknowledging the issue and suggesting ways it could be fixed, the owner was defensive and insisted that "it just needs to settle in the frame" and "the edges of the drawing aren't straight". It felt like I had to work to persuade them to have it re-done and centered properly. Remarkably, the second order was never completed. Over 3 months, I received zero communication from the store about the order. I finally just went in and asked for the second piece to be returned, and I'm grateful that an employee provided a refund. If there was an issue with supply, they could have simply suggested an alternate frame that was in stock, or at the very least communicated that there would be a delay. My impression from this experience was that the quality of work and communication/customer service are below average, particularly given the price of services.

Fantastic experience at SOHO. Brought in several pieces requiring variety of work from new matting to frames and glass type. Kody was incredible! The initial apt was a few hours and we greatly appreciated his suggestions, expertise and friendly demeanour. The pieces turned out exactly as we’d hoped. Highly recommend seeing Kody, it was a great experience at SOHO thanks to him!
Tamar is so lovely and helpful when getting things framed! We are lucky to have such a caring shop owner in our neighbourhood and now our home is filled with beautifully framed memories!

Excellent customer service, we are a corporate company, we requested a magazine print quality in a three-part frame, Kody took our request, shared the mock-up, payment was smooth, received frame in a day and was done perfectly, great quality, perfectly done we love it thank you again!!

One of the new but well organized gallery in west district of Toronto. Recently Emerging Young Artists show was held here. Vibrant and active place.
Will steal your ideas and pass them off as their own. Proceed with caution. Creative thieves are the lowest form of thieves.
Great place to hold an exhibition. Warm people with enough space make it a very lovely atmosphere
The space looks exactly like the photos. Beautiful gallery.

reviews: This store is special! Filled with handmade and small brand goodies as well as local art on show and so much more :•) sweet staff and an obviously thoughtful and beautifully curated collection of wares. Great shop for gifts or treating yourself ~
Fun, eclectic art gallery & shop! Great selection of sustainable goods, crafts & curios. The proprietor is community minded & is always finding ways to give back. Time & money we’ll spent.

Simply amazing local business and people. Thank you for a fantastic online purchase. Was so pleased to see it in person. Can't wait to surprise my wife.. a great find. Can't wait to walk through the store once restrictions are removed. Great new addition to our home to be.
Toronto is so lucky to have Likely! Brooke, the owner, is one of a kind. This space is so much more than a store ~ it's a magic vehicle. Thank you everyone

What a beautiful store with an amazing owner. Tons of cute finds for everyone in your life. This is a go to spot for gifting and there are so many local artisans featured. If you needs candles, apothecary products, cards, clothing or legit anything under the sun, they carry it! So beautifully curated and a cozy space for artists. Check out their gorgeous display windows or place an order online (both are worth it).

Here are pictures of the summer exhibition gallery and a painting by Janet Kimantas and photography from Laurie Slater.
I got to see the All Green Sculpture exhibit. Many moving pieces. It a great spot for small exhibits.
I love that there's a gallery here that has frequent exhibitions.
I have been a member of this gallery for about ten years. It provides a great exhibition space for emerging as well as veteran artists.  A well known curator recommended it to me.

52.name: Arsenal Contemporary Art Toronto
52.formatted_address: 45 Ernest Ave, Toronto, ON M6P 3M7, Canada
reviews: great free exhibits. would benefit from some wall text. also very hard to find front door

I love the Arsenal galleries. Toronto's is smaller than Montreal's, usually with one main exhibit and one smaller gallery. But it seems to allow them to be selective and choose some really spectacular installation exhibits, and create a singular, unique atmosphere in the space.  Highly recommend a visit, especially if you're visiting MoCA a couple blocks away!  Check to make sure they're open (i.e. not between installations) when planning. That goes for most galleries though.

Like it’s location in Montréal, Arsenal Contemporary Art in Toronto is a must see! Whether you are a local or you are simply visiting Toronto, their carefully curated exhibitions with both Canadian and international artists is something not to miss!

Such rude customer service. The woman working the front desk had such a sour attitude it totally ruined the experience. The exhibition itself was wonderful, I tried to grab a brochure at the end and woman was so rude, and passive aggressive.

David Liss who was previously at the MOCA does curatorial projects here. He always has a unique view of contemporary artists and selects fascinating artists who are accomplished but not completely mainstream. The shows are often museum quality at Arsenal/Division - in both substance & presentation.

53.name: Bob Carnie Printmaking & Gallery

reviews: I ordered some framing supplies through the shop. Bob & Anam were very helpful and accommodating, and I highly recommend their framing services!
This shop provides great photo, framing and print services. The staff is knowledgeable, accommodating and very friendly.  Excellenté.
Great gallery and amazing printing services for enlargements
Amazing art space in a surprisingly interesting pocket of the city.
Solid place for quality photographic printing. And, no "attitude'

beautiful gallery and lovely owners

reviews: Olga is one of the most important dealers in Toronto.  Her exhibition schedule is well  thought out, bringing challenging art to the city.

I really enjoyed the art. A very interesting show of contemporary painting. Unfortunately my experience was soured by the rude treatment I received from the attendant. I visited about 30 galleries while I was visiting Toronto and this was the only one that chose to be rude to me when I mentioned that I was an artist. Artist visit galleries to see the work of other artists. Not everyone is a buyer. That's how it goes. Get over yourself.
Thoughts after my first visit - stunning and superb. A beautiful use of a heritage building that allows for the flow of natural light. Great space!
This gallery is close to the Christopher Cutts gallery and so the trip is a two for one. The space is awe inspiring and permits installations on the grand scale. Art is well displayed and curated.

This gallery came highly recommended to me. I don't have any background in art whatsoever, however, with all the exhibitions I've been too, the staff have all been open and wonderful, with the art being very accessible.

64.name: Berenson Fine Art
64.formatted_address: By appointment only, 300 Bloor St E, Toronto, ON M4W 3Y2, Canada
reviews: I love the welcoming atmosphere at this gallery ,  the time that the owner takes to walk you through each piece of art exhibited is extraordinary. Amazed by her knowledge and talent to tell each painting like a story. I first saw the works of Marco Sassone at Berenson Art and fell in love with them. I also deeply enjoyed some other exhibits like "Home". The owner was kind enough to introduce the artist to my little one who is an animal lover,  she was super excited and remembers that experience to date! Always enjoy visiting the gallery. Keep up the great work!

Very nice gallery with diverse list of artists. Small but well appointed space. They have great opening nights for their exhibitions where you can meet the artist and socialize with local Toronto crowds. The permanent collection has wonderful selection of photography. Many international artists on the stable along with well known Canadian painters. Most of their exhibitions are featured in national news and press. I have been a client of the gallery since it’s opening in 2011 and would highly recommend anyone interested in art to visit it.

I have had the pleasure of attending most of the artist exhibits at Berenson Fine Art and have been amazed at the caliber of talent that has graced their walls.  A couple of pieces that I have by Marco Sassone, who has a permanent exhibit there and is an internationally renowned artist, with artwork in galleries and museums around the world.  You can usually see exhibiting artists in featured on the news and in publications.  Definitely keep an eye out and try to make it to one of the shows.  They are fabulous!

Berenson Fine Art Gallery is the epidome of Fine Art gallery. Berenson can pride itself not only for the extraordinary collections and exhibitions but also for the expert staff. I have expanded my collection with several pieces from Berenson Fine Art Gallery. Whether you are looking for beautiful oil painting or a water color or a photograph or a drawing, this gallery must be a stop on your list. Emilia's wealth of knowledge will inform and entertain you and she and her staff will make sure you are a happy return collector! Thank you Berenson for being a True Fine Art Gallery, and thank you for curating wonderful shows and exhibitions for Toronto's Fine Art connoisseur community.

I love this gallery with serious art projects and cultural exhibitions, and trying not to miss any opening reception where people could share their thoughts about works of Canadian and international artists.  A truly unique art gallery with years of experience.  IMG_1349.JPG

65.name: Alliance Francaise Toronto - Downtown campus
65.formatted_address: 24 Spadina Rd, Toronto, ON M5R 2S7, Canada
reviews: I took A1.1 lessons which is most basic level serving learners who do not know a word of french.. In the name of immersion the tutors would only speak in french & respond back in french.. I ended up not learning anything. To understand what was being spoken in class, I needed to use google translate. I would not recommend anyone with no French back ground from joining this course.

I took private lessons with Gaëlle Deschamps for the past half-year. She has always been extremely organized and very well prepared for lessons. The lesson notes are clear and concise in a Google Doc making them easy to access whenever I need to refer to a past concept.  The topics she chose were always very stimulating and varied from week to week so that I build a firm foundation in the knowledge required for eventually completing B1. For many of the lessons she provided real world examples (websites from France, videos from France, resources for grammar etc.) that I could see how the new grammar concepts are applied as well as build my vocabulary. She was very patient to review anything that I did not fully understand or assimilate when it was presented in earlier lessons.  She is a fabulous professor and I would highly recommend lessons with her.

I just finished my 3rd online ZOOM course with AF.  A fantastic way to learn French and enjoy the company of other students online.    The course instructors are all great with an easy manner and boundless enthusiasm for making sure you get the most out of your journey with the French language and culture.

I took two conversation courses online and was quite happy. Our teacher was Taraneh Vafaee. She has a very pleasant way of teaching that makes the classes interesting, informal while getting us to learn a lot. She takes into consideration repeat students, (she gets them as they like her way of teaching) and does not repeat the texts and subjects she used in the previous course so one never gets bored. Being a conversation course the teacher needs to adapt its level to the level of the students which can vary a lot even if the students have been assessed and given a level. She is able to this very well.  I do have a proposal for getting the course even better:  At the end of the course it would greatly help to give each student an evaluation in order for the student to be able to judge on the best method to improve further. At this time, unless expressly requested, there is no evaluation brief report.

Jolanda deserves a medal from the Government of Canada and the Government of France for her efforts to teach French. She really deserves to be recognized - she is most deserving. I feel very lucky and I am grateful she is my professor. She is totally amazing. She truly inspires me at each lesson to work harder and to continue with my French studies - My private tuition fees with Alliance Francis are totally worth it!!!!  Jolanda has the most amazing patience when she corrects me and repeats corrections - she never makes me feel bad about my errors she makes me want to improve and be more proficient. She takes the time to explain French grammar to me and as a result I understand it more and more.  As much as I am a senior,  Jolanda makes me want to learn more about the French language and to speak it well.I will start my third year with her in September  Its is also very helpful  the learning material and exercises are excellent and well written which allows me to learn step by step.  Also the audio dialogue on the CD's is very good and allows me to improve my understanding of oral French.  - I am one very happy student of Alliance  Francais  and it is because of Jolanda !!!! merci : )

66.name: D & E Lake Ltd. Fine Arts
66.formatted_address: 1199 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4T 3A8, Canada
reviews: I ordered a vintage book from D&E Lake and the experience was terrific. Very quick shipping, packaged with great care, arrived promptly and easy to order online. A terrific store!

I telephoned with an information request - the man that answered the telephone refused to allow me to explain my question.  He hung up as quickly as he could - saying that I had to "come in". His customer service mandate has made me think that I should never look to D. E. Lake for help again. It is the Third Time that I have thought of their store: The First Time The Last Time The Never Again Time Thursday, March 1st, 2018 at 14:50
Absurdly rude and creepy shopkeeper. Visiting this store was a deeply uncomfortable experience.

The receptionist at the front desk carries himself like Spanish royalty. Almost unbelievably bad public relations skills and total disregard for customers who provide him with probably his only way to earn an income. unfortunately, zero star review not allowed...

reviews: This is a great place to both view art and to become a member. There are many incredible opportunities to connect with other artists and learn or join. The artists and association leaders are so lovely and helpful. From children to adults, all are welcome to enjoy the exhibits for free. Worth a visit for sure, not just for the art but also for a visit through history learning how women artists worked to make a safe and welcoming space for the many female artists of today. Such rich history.

The WAA were wonderful hosts for our engagement party. Setup was seamless, the building is beautiful and the art is an amazing backdrop and activity for guests. I would highly recommend hosting an event here, or just taking a visit to see some gorgeous art.
Wonderful yet little known gallery in the heart of the city. Did I mention that it is free?
Two galleries under one roof, always something happening.
Fantastic space and amazing gallery!

77.formatted_address: 87 Avenue Rd #2, Toronto, ON M5R 3R9, Canada
reviews: The "Galerie de Bellefeuille" has redefined the "5 star" standard of perfection and excellence amongst local art galleries in Toronto. Established in September Toronto in 2017, this art gallery is definitely a "must see" gallery in the Toronto area. It exceeds by far other art galleries in Toronto, as well as other galleries worldwide. Their select and tasteful collection of contemporary/pop art is nothing short of sensational. The gallery's layout is perfect and very well lit, and the staff is genuinely friendly, welcoming, helpful, and knowledgeable.
Beautiful and moderate large gallery featuring some unique artworks. Very Yorkville vibe though. It's nice and cute. Friendly people.
A gorgeous light filled gallery that is spacious and shows the contemporary art well. Fitting that it's located in the upscale neighborhood of Yorkville.
I've only walked by this gallery when it was closed, but I love the colourful sculptures and photos. I don't know their pricing, but I would imagine it's not cheap.
Amazing staff! We were there with my daughter for a friends gallery opening and they were so welcoming to her.

78.name: Hazelton Fine Art Galleries
78.formatted_address: 14 Hazelton Ave, Toronto, ON M5R 2E2, Canada
reviews: The best gallery in Toronto. Great selection of artworks by the Modern Masters such as Salvador Dali and Picasso + new contemporary talent as well. Good and very knowledgeable staff too. Five stars !
Beautiful art. Fabulous, knowledgeable service!
Fantastic customer service and a great selection of internationally renown artists.
Brilliant allery

79.name: LUMAS Toronto
79.formatted_address: 159 Yorkville Ave, Toronto, ON M5R 1C4, Canada
reviews: I ordered a piece that was shipped from Germany - it arrived damaged at my home via ups. What impressed me was the way in which the team at LUMAS set about immediately addressing this issue. Awa and her colleagues were exceptionally attentive and thorough in their follow up in securing a replacement. In the current environment, things will go wrong. What matters most is how a business responds. This one responded exceptionally well. I thoroughly recommend not just for the art work, but for the service.
Really loved the gallery and the special dinner we had there

When I first procured art from LUMAS, it felt as if the entire company was created for me.  The organization’s values, business model, and quality service are all bedrocks I would open a gallery around.  They have disrupted the industry and have tapped into a new art audience in the process.

Happy to see LUMAS has made it to Toronto! Great place to pick up museum-quality, limited edition, photographic artwork at a fair price range. Incredible staff, portfolio, and location. Love the European concept. Highly recommend to anyone looking for artwork for their home or business.

I went to Lumas because I was looking for small artworks to put in my living room and I was really surprised by the large range of options that Lumas offers. The quality is also very good whether you have a big or a small budget. The smallest piece I've got from them was only 38$ with a guarantee on it. I also wanted to mention the staff, everybody was very nice and helpful!

reviews: Talia is an absolute treat to work with and Art Interiors has an amazing selection!

We have bought unique pieces of art from Art Interiors for the past 16 years and counting ... this is a friendly accessible gallery with a diverse collection of Canadian artists.  We are grateful for the daily JOY we get from these works!

I ordered an Andrea Soos paper piece from here, and unfortunately it had been sold already but not taken down from the website - Ana contacted me personally to apologize, and I was able to pick from the next batch of Andrea's paper pieces! This was my first time buying art from here, and despite the first hiccup I would definitely buy again - their customer service is great! Very caring and thoughtful

86.name: Canvas Gallery
86.formatted_address: 344 Westmoreland Ave N #104A, Toronto, ON M6H 3A7, Canada
reviews: A wide selection of local artists ...sizes, styles, themes, designs that are perfect for bringing into your home.  The owner who was helping my wife and I could not have been more friendly and knowledgeable and very patient in explaining how to approach the purchase and how to plan for having a piece in our.  Highly recommend!

Found a nice painting while browsing their gallery on line. Very accomodating through the purchase process.  Had a chance to buy another piece from this gallery and enjoyed a nice chat with Mark. Really pleasant and helpful people.

Lots of beautiful choices in art, and the staff made it a relaxed and easy experience for me. Loved that I was able to try the painting before purchase too. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for some beautiful, Canadian art to brighten up their home.
Found an absolutely beautiful and unique piece. Very relaxed vibe. Helpful and friendly owners and staff. Would return again!

Bought a gorgeous piece by Donna Andreychuk and couldn't be happier with it. Special thanks to Mark who helped us with the decision and dropped it off for us. Also for giving us the information we needed and then leaving us to decide for ourselves

87.name: COOPER COLE
87.formatted_address: 1134 Dupont Street and, 1136 Dupont St, Toronto, ON M6H 2A2, Canada
reviews: Hands down, this is the best contemporary art gallery in Toronto!
Toronto has needed an international scope forever. GB Jones and Genesis P-Orridge. Wow. About f in time! Best show ever. Old stodgy Art snobs of boring Toronto art can go f themselves.
Cooper Cole Gallery has the eye for imagination and discipline that makes a good curator and practice.  Good work! Book me.
The staff here are great.
Beautiful and fascinating pieces.

editorial_summary.overview: Independent art space holding contemporary exhibitions by North American artists & fairs.

88.name: Imagefoundry
88.formatted_address: 1581 Dupont St, Toronto, ON M6P 3S5, Canada
reviews: I contracted with Image Foundry for reproductions of two much loved oil paintings done by an artist family friend to whom we were returning the originals. The reproductions were phenomenal. The colours in the repros were, in my opinion, indistinguishable from the originals. I highly recommend Image Foundry to anyone who wishes to get a work of art reproduced.

I was in the gallery when Mr. Dhaliwal came in. As always, Dimitri was nothing but courteous and professional. I have been a client of Imagefoundry for several years. Dimitri's work is outstanding. He has the highest of standards. On a personal level, he is always professional. He combines that with kindness and a great sense of humor. There are many very good reasons why so many artists, myself included come here from all over the province to avail ourselves of the excellent service and product offered by Dimitri at Imagefoundry.

I use Dimitri Levanoff of Image Foundry for digitally imaging my original artwork. He is thorough, professional, highly skilled and intuitive when it comes to dealing with the vagaries of varying media and requirements. His work has always been done to the highest standards. He gives you images tailored to your own requirements, and has clear suggestions if ever you feel ambiguous or uncertain of your own end goals when it comes to what to do with the digital images he supplies. I have found his large format print service to be completely satisfactory as well. Not to mention he has a beautiful dog that greets you without being demanding!

I approached Imagefoundry with a small job to scan two collages to create prints of the originals to give as Christmas gifts.  Dimtri, was helpful, straightforward, flexible and very fair in the pricing of my small projects.  I am absolutely thrilled with the quality of the resulting prints and the support I received during the process.  Already thinking about another project to reproduce and share other family art.  I highly recommend Imagefoundry.

I am really happy with the scans I had done with Dimitri. He was very professional and attentive. He took the time to sit with me and go over each image (there were over 20). He also took the time to speak to me over the phone regarding details after the initial job was done. Highly recommend!

89.name: 2E Gallery
89.formatted_address: 213 Sterling Rd, Toronto, ON M6R 2B2, Canada
reviews: Banksy show was great but the audio tour wasn’t functioning properly

90.name: Franz Kaka
90.formatted_address: 1485 Dupont St #208, Toronto, ON M6P 3S2, Canada

91.name: Studio Paradise
91.formatted_address: 1538 Dupont St, Toronto, ON M6P 4G7, Canada
reviews: Great art and great deals

92.name: Arsenal Contemporary Art Toronto
92.formatted_address: 45 Ernest Ave, Toronto, ON M6P 3M7, Canada
reviews: great free exhibits. would benefit from some wall text. also very hard to find front door

I love the Arsenal galleries. Toronto's is smaller than Montreal's, usually with one main exhibit and one smaller gallery. But it seems to allow them to be selective and choose some really spectacular installation exhibits, and create a singular, unique atmosphere in the space.  Highly recommend a visit, especially if you're visiting MoCA a couple blocks away!  Check to make sure they're open (i.e. not between installations) when planning. That goes for most galleries though.

Like it’s location in Montréal, Arsenal Contemporary Art in Toronto is a must see! Whether you are a local or you are simply visiting Toronto, their carefully curated exhibitions with both Canadian and international artists is something not to miss!

Such rude customer service. The woman working the front desk had such a sour attitude it totally ruined the experience. The exhibition itself was wonderful, I tried to grab a brochure at the end and woman was so rude, and passive aggressive.

David Liss who was previously at the MOCA does curatorial projects here. He always has a unique view of contemporary artists and selects fascinating artists who are accomplished but not completely mainstream. The shows are often museum quality at Arsenal/Division - in both substance & presentation.

93.name: Christie Contemporary
93.formatted_address: 64 Miller St, Toronto, ON M6N 2Z9, Canada
reviews: I’ve only seen one show here but it was outstanding quality. A beautiful, tiny gallery with a small selection of books.
Beautifully curated art. Always fun to chat with Claire
Friendly, knowledgeable staff and fascinating work by local artists.
Nice intimate gallery space. Great art.

95.name: The Loon
95.formatted_address: 227 Sterling Rd #109a, Toronto, ON M6P 0A1, Canada
reviews: Very small gallery.  Washroom not accessible.  Worked as crowded venue for Jeff Bierk's Photography exhibit for contact.
very cool gallery, nice staff too and everything was good
Beer was cold and staff was very friendly
Nice gallery with nice people
Loved it

96.name: Queen's Shop - Fine Hairdressing Inc
96.formatted_address: 1169 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1M9, Canada
reviews: Queen’s Shop is an amazing hidden gem on Bloor St. I have not visited a hair salon in Toronto for such a long time, so I felt really lucky I found this location by chance. The salon was clean, safe, they follow COVID protocol, and they’re so friendly about it too!  Diyar did an amazing job highlighting my dark asian hair! I always struggled with explaining what exactly I wanted with my hairdresser and Diyar was able to translate my blundering description into exactly what I wanted! I love my hair! They brightened up my hair to this lovely sandy colour that feels healthy and not fried up at all. Whenever I am in Toronto this is my go-to place for hair. I’ll let my before/after photos speak for themselves.  This is the place! GO HERE! You’ll thank me later!

I have spent the last decade in search of a hairdresser who understood my thick and curly hair, my personal style, and who is a pleasure to spend time with. I have found all of these qualities in Rachel so when she recently moved to Queen’s Shop I followed.  Every time I see Rachel, I leave with the best haircut I’ve ever had. She is also incredibly kind and personable and I really look forward to my upcoming appointments. She has never commented negatively on how much hair I have so I don’t feel like I need to apologize in advance every time I sit in the chair. Thanks to Rachel, I feel like I can stray from “safe” cuts because I know I’m in great hands and I also know she’s going to find the perfect balance between my inspiration photos and my hair type. And the cozy and welcoming environment of Queen’s Shop is the icing on the cake. Highly recommended!!!

I have been going to Queen's Shop for a couple of years now and every time it is such a great experience. I love the emphasis on sustainability at the salon and it is always very clean. Ari is an amazing stylist, I appreciate them taking the time to really understand what I want and cutting my hair in a way that really compliments my face! I always feel so confident walking out of the salon after getting my hair done by Ari! Highly recommend!

I went to Queen’s shop for a major colour correction. They walked me through the whole process and took their time ensuring my hair was never compromised. Even though the process was quite long (I had been warned it would be), they were very patient and attentive to my needs throughout. I came out with a great cut, colour and highlights! Thank you so much Alicia and team!

I have been attending this salon for over two years now. My stylist / colourist went on mat leave and I saw someone new to the salon. I paid $300 for a root touch up and a cut. A significant amount of my roots remained grey (approximately 40-50%). When I contacted the salon owner / manager to let them know, they were dismissive. I was offered to come in the next week to correct the issue or a free treatment, the value of which is under $20. I expressed concern for my hair and personal health and as a result, I am not comfortable treating my hair so much in a short period of time. My concerns were not respected despite that I paid a significant amount of money for a service I did not receive. Many other options were available to make this right and the owner / manager of the salon did not care to work together to resolve the issue. As a result, I will no longer be going to this salon and feel that other consumers should be aware of this experience so they can make informed decisions.  Edited to reply to salon owner below: Alicia, you ghosted me when I expressed to you that there were options to discuss besides the free treatment or forcing me to do something I was not comfortable doing. I also requested a phone call to discuss and you never called. It was not my responsibility to make this right, it was yours. If resolution of this came from a place of valuing your customer and standing behind the product your salon offers, you could have expressed to me an interest in hearing my suggestions or come up with some compromises of your own.

97.name: Analogue Gallery
97.formatted_address: 163 Sterling Rd unit 189, Toronto, ON M6P 0A1, Canada
reviews: Just went here.. pulled at the door twice, woman sitting behind the desk looked at me twice.. called to see if they were open and no answer. Confused on this place. Not sure if they actually sell but they should as per Blog T.O?
Saturday Oct 12th. Drove an hour to town to find the gallery closed for construction. You could have announced that on your website. Not cool!
There's no other place in the city that has images like Analogue Gallery.
I love a piece

98.name: Robert Kananaj Gallery
98.formatted_address: 172 St Helens Ave, Toronto, ON M6H 4A1, Canada
reviews: Walked by today and toured the place with Roberta, she was really kind and very knowledgeable. Cool space, selling works from known and unknown artists each with a story of their own.
Love the location and energy of RKG gallery.  One of the best art galleries in the city. Congrats.
Awesome original works and more. Peace.
Excellent show "On Squares" by Lee Ip
Great Gallery wonderful artwork

99.name: Daniel Faria Gallery
99.formatted_address: 188 St Helens Ave, Toronto, ON M6H 4A1, Canada
reviews: Great gallery with great exhibits.  Well worth to get on the mailing list.  Always fascinating art and interesting people.
Interesting roster of Canadian artists, great gallery space and helpful friendly staff.
Didn't like the art display
Wonderful!

100.name: Narwhal
100.formatted_address: 2104 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6R 1W9, Canada
reviews: We had a great experience hosting our event at Narwhal. It's such a great space and they are pleasant to work with! We will gladly host another event here!
One of the new but well organized gallery in west district of Toronto. Recently Emerging Young Artists show was held here. Vibrant and active place.
Will steal your ideas and pass them off as their own. Proceed with caution. Creative thieves are the lowest form of thieves.
Great place to hold an exhibition. Warm people with enough space make it a very lovely atmosphere
The space looks exactly like the photos. Beautiful gallery.

101.name: Double Happiness Projects (DHP)
101.formatted_address: 603 Keele St 1st FLR, Toronto, ON M6N 3E5, Canada
reviews: Great space.  Wonderful staff
epic establishment

102.name: Malcolm Rains Studio
102.formatted_address: 10 Morrow Ave suite 204, Toronto, ON M6R 2J1, Canada

103.name: Zalucky Contemporary
103.formatted_address: 3044 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1Z3, Canada
reviews: Perfectly displayed artwork. Knowledgeable staff welcoming and informative to the non artist. Easy to find location.
The owner was lovely and the exhibit was extraordinary!!! Really special work, must see.
Small space and a great addition to the Junction especially with the small town feel of this area.  Great little spot during your afternoon.

104.name: Likely General
104.formatted_address: 389 Roncesvalles Ave, Toronto, ON M6R 2N1, Canada
reviews: This store is special! Filled with handmade and small brand goodies as well as local art on show and so much more :•) sweet staff and an obviously thoughtful and beautifully curated collection of wares. Great shop for gifts or treating yourself ~
Fun, eclectic art gallery & shop! Great selection of sustainable goods, crafts & curios. The proprietor is community minded & is always finding ways to give back. Time & money we’ll spent.

Simply amazing local business and people. Thank you for a fantastic online purchase. Was so pleased to see it in person. Can't wait to surprise my wife.. a great find. Can't wait to walk through the store once restrictions are removed. Great new addition to our home to be.
Toronto is so lucky to have Likely! Brooke, the owner, is one of a kind. This space is so much more than a store ~ it's a magic vehicle. Thank you everyone

What a beautiful store with an amazing owner. Tons of cute finds for everyone in your life. This is a go to spot for gifting and there are so many local artisans featured. If you needs candles, apothecary products, cards, clothing or legit anything under the sun, they carry it! So beautifully curated and a cozy space for artists. Check out their gorgeous display windows or place an order online (both are worth it).

editorial_summary.overview: Eclectic home decor, handmade goods & edible gifts like honey & preserves in a bright, spare shop.

105.name: Imagine Cinemas Market Square
105.formatted_address: 80 Front St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1T4, Canada
reviews: Great Hideaway theatre, rich with film history and architecture on the walls. Great staff that makes you feel welcomed. Imagine Cinemas has great popcorn! * some of the theatres have smaller screens then I’m used to. But enjoyment wasn’t affected especially seating in the reclining seats.
great place! been here twice in the last week accidentally but we’ve been the only ones in the theatre both times! it’s great and we love the sofa recliners- game changer

An amazing value for money and such a great experience. The seats are definitely top notch and the screen is brilliant as well as the sound. Definitely not IMAX but definitely more than worth what you pay for.  Highly recommend going during weekdays since we had the theatre almost to ourselves.
5 stars just based on the seats? Yes. Everything else is standard movie theater business as usual. There is no cell service downstairs and no wi-fi.

My all time favourite movie theatre! I love how it’s not shiny, new and high tech like Cineplex. It has this old school look and feel, staff are friendly and inviting, and once your in your movie and you lay back in the reclining chairs with your snacks, your in heaven.

106.name: Scotiabank Theatre Toronto
106.formatted_address: 259 Richmond St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3M6, Canada
reviews: Amazing Dolby surround sound experience in this theatre.  I was here for Doctor strange and it was fun since the plan was very spontaneous. The 3D glasses are crystal clear and they clean and decent.  They have amazing cafeteria and has popcorn coke and other meals available.  There is good leg space on the top row chairs and the experience of imax makes it even better.

First time watching a movie at this theater. It is quite large with 14/15 screening rooms. We watched The Matrix Resurrections pre-screening on December 16th. The whole building was decked out to give it a Matrix themed feel it was really well done. Theatre seating was at 50% capacity so it didn’t feel crowded and we were able to keep a safe distance from everyone. Getting into the theater was a bit crowded but everyone was masked and once you got into the room it was fine. The screens are a good size and the sound system is good as well.  There is underground parking in the same building which is convenient. PARKING TIP: DO NOT PAY AT THE KIOSKS. PAY AT THE EXIT GATE WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD. We made the mistake of paying at the kiosk and then tried to exit the parking lot but because there was a huge line of cars trying leave, it took us 45min to make it to the exit gate after the show and ended up having to pay the parking fee twice because we took too long to get out. Or better yet, don’t drive. Since we were coming from outside the city we unfortunately had to drive.

The place is on the 2nd floor. It's a very large place with high ceilings, lots of glass. The staff are friendly and helpful. The building is clean, tidy and well maintained and well lite. It's a must see kind of place.

The theatre can easily be accessible by TTC (Osgoode Station) and there ample parking available in the area if you’re driving there (parking option is not cheap though).  You get mixed feelings from the staff; it seems like some of them don’t care at all/ don’t know what they’re doing and some are very friendly and helpful.  The place is well-maintained and the each theatre has comfy chairs.  I just wish everyone would take their garbage outside with them and throw them in the garbage bin. A lot of people leave popcorn/sandwich bags on their seats when they leave.

Currently a Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) location. Escalators are now back in working order! Big crowds so give yourself time to navigate and find your cinema. Volunteers of TIFF are amazingly helpful. Ask them at the outer doors where your line is because there are some that start outside! Otherwise you may make your way in and upstairs, only to find yourself having to travel back down and out. Restrooms by the lounge and gaming area are the largest ones! If you wait to use the ones by the inner cinemas, unfortunately those only have two stalls for women's room.

editorial_summary.overview: 14-screen multiplex (including IMAX & 3D) with the latest Hollywood films, plus a licensed lounge.

107.name: Imagine Cinemas Carlton Cinema
107.formatted_address: 20 Carlton St., Toronto, ON M5B 2H5, Canada
reviews: Love how intimate the theatre is and the location (near College Station). I like how they have dairy-free "butter" for popcorn (which is of no extra cost). You can also get flavourings and real butter (which costs extra).

A really surprising theater. I came there for the first time and thought to myself "this looks a bit creepy", but this thought completely disappeared when I entered it. Its really cosy and familial. The screening rooms are small but cosy and you really connect with the audience more.

I love this place. This is the equivalent to your hole in the wall restaurant where people are nice and the food is great. Theatres are small and cozy, $10 regular ticket and $7 on Tues. You can get bar drinks or boozy slushies (!) or tea on addition to your regular movie fare. Highly recommended!

Great place if you like watching films in a quieter space. The seats are comfy and the overall atmosphere is cozy. Staff are very friendly. The selection of films is great, they'll have newer releases 2-3 months after they come out as well as showing older films.

I went to this theatre 10 years ago and it was a dump then. Took my son to see minions today thinking it must have been renovated since my last visit...... wrong! I have underwear bigger than the screen it was showing on. Got a refund, staff were very kind and understanding.

editorial_summary.overview: Multiplex with film-themed art showing Hollywood, independent, Canadian & foreign flicks.

108.name: TIFF Bell Lightbox
108.formatted_address: 350 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3X5, Canada
reviews: I was fortunate enough to attend TIFF..In conversation with Taylor swift! The best thing ever happened to me, I love TayTay & had been waiting from so long to see her & FINALLY❤️ I loved the theatre, audio-visual were on point & made a great experience for attendees.

A not for profit organization that screens more artistic movies than the big budget Hollywood extravaganzas we are used to.  This location has multiple screens for large showings (250 or so) to some smaller theatres that seat 20 viewers.  The staff and volunteers here are very friendly and always look forward to the big September festival that brings a worldwide cast of talent to showcase their goods for all to enjoy

Excellent seating arrangement and ambiance. The sound is amazing, I felt the screen size is a bit smaller compared to the regular Cineplex though . Excellent location at the heart of Toronto's Entertainment District.

The theatre is amazing and has a very nice viewing podium. Therefore even if you are in the front the movie doesn't look so close. The movie selections are really good as movies which don't get released elsewhere are present here. Members also get to watch movies for free too and the price of a ticket is also very affordable as well. Definitely make a trip to watch international acclaim movies without fail.

First time in and loved the ambience and the screening rooms. Quite spacious and friendly ushers to direct you as needed even if it's just getting to the restroom. Not privileged enough to get into the lounge so had to settle for the smaller cafeteria experience. Gift shop offered many TIFF assortment of purchase options and very informative staff. Very clean, well maintained.

editorial_summary.overview: This centre of the Toronto International Film Festival features world cinema & events year-round.

109.name: Cineplex Cinemas Yonge-Dundas and VIP
109.formatted_address: 10 Dundas St E #402, Toronto, ON M5B 2G9, Canada
reviews: Such a great experience!  This was my first time going to this Cineplex and I can easily say it was much nicer than others I’ve been to. Not only is it conveniently located, but it’s really easy getting tickets and entering in.  All workers checked vaccination receipts correctly and wouldn’t let you enter without proof of vaccination.  I went to see The French Dispatch which was located on the upper level. The theatre was kept quite clean and I had no complaints.  Would definitely recommend to anyone in the area!

I love this place. First of all Dundas square is very lively place and this Cineplex is at Dundas and Yonge street mostly into the hustle and bustle of the city where music, Yonge people and diversity can all be seen at one place. On top of everything it screens the Hindi movies as well. That is icing on cake. It houses 20+ Audi's and ambience inside the Cineplex is also great. Overall great experience. Good for families, couples, friends group of all ages. Love to go there whenever I can.

One of the few Cineplexes in city where you shall find multi linguistics movies running almost every day. This Cineplex has the rare 4DX theatres which is an experience of its own kind. Rest all are pretty much similar to other Cineplex in Toronto and GTA. I shall definitely recommend this place for movies for the amazing service by staff and well maintained theatres
Nice location, nice ambiance. Theater is huge with a great selection.  Not to busy. Theater was clean and comfortable. Happy with my visit!

I always go to this Cinema to watch movies. It's conveniently located at the corner of Dundas and Yonge Street where the subway is. I watched the James Bond movie "No Time To Die" in the Imax Theatre. The place, as always, is clean and tidy. The washroom too. I think the management is really serious in keeping this place in a great shape. Highly recommended.

editorial_summary.overview: Modern multiplex cinema chain screening the latest Hollywood films, plus new independent releases.

110.name: Jackman Hall
110.formatted_address: 317 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5T 1G4, Canada
reviews: It is a small Theatre with wonderful projection and great sound. I visited it during TIFF, but its programme is very good.  BEWARE, you can't eat nothing in the Theatre, I got a reprimand for my cough drops (I could use them once I showed the package) though.
Very good auditorium, screen and projector were very detailed, and while not the best Atmos setup I've heard, audio was very clean and sharp as well.

Small, clean and comfortable theatre located below the main gallery. May be a bit tricky to find (Go down the ramp near the sculpture outside the gallery, and enter through side doors that indicate volunteer entry only). Art documentaries, arthouse films and biopics are often shown here. A cafeteria is located near the gallery but usually closes soon before the evening showtimes.
It's not a massive theatre and the sound isn't spectacular, but they chose good films. We need more people attending alternative theatre
Enjoyed TBFF while there! Seats were comfy and sound was good. Next time I'll spend more time at AGO.

editorial_summary.overview: Small, modern cinematic venue at an art gallery screening documentaries & arthouse movies.

111.name: Blahzay Creative
111.formatted_address: 170 Mill St, Toronto, ON M5A 0G2, Canada
reviews: Love!

112.name: Tiff Bell Lightbox
112.formatted_address: 350 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1J2, Canada

113.name: Scotiabank Theatre Toronto
113.formatted_address: 259 Richmond St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3M6, Canada
reviews: Amazing Dolby surround sound experience in this theatre.  I was here for Doctor strange and it was fun since the plan was very spontaneous. The 3D glasses are crystal clear and they clean and decent.  They have amazing cafeteria and has popcorn coke and other meals available.  There is good leg space on the top row chairs and the experience of imax makes it even better.

The place is well-maintained and the each theatre has comfy chairs.  I just wish everyone would take their garbage outside with them and throw them in the garbage bin. 114.name: The Royal
114.formatted_address: 608 College St, Toronto, ON M6G 1B4, Canada
reviews: Came to attend the fourth annual Toronto Food and Film Festival! It was a great space for the event. Clean and but not accessible because it's an old building. Washrooms are on the second floor which is accessible by stairs. Street parking only. Would visit again.

Great venue! Saw a comedy show here and everything went so smoothly. Everything from getting checked in to finding seats to leaving the venue was seamless. And they have to most comfortable seats! Super friendly staff too.

Great location, comfortable spacious seats, lots of good options for drinking and eating. Washrooms are clean, nice and ample. Nothing to fault here. Sound was fine and any concert or event here will surely be intimate. Nice place, makes you wish for the good ol' days when you went to the movies at great places like these and not the mass-produced, lifeless mall options of today. No wonder people just stay at home now.  We need more Royal theatres :-)

The theater is beautiful! The sound is great and seats are very comfy. My only issue if I had to pick something is the concessions are way too pricy. $6 for a sparkling mineral water is a bit outrageous as well as the candy for $10. Staff could be a little more friendly especially since they are expecting tips

Former community cinema that shuttered during the pandemic (after selling membership options), reborn as the shop for Volo with an occasional special comedy/film event. Wonderful venue, especially after the 2020 facelift, but no publicity for events for local foot traffic. I wish the shop staff would stop denying that the cinema ever had regular showings; I'm glad they've found a way to stay open, but they've rejected the local film-going community entirely.

editorial_summary.overview: Refurbished 1939 cinema screening independent films, global documentaries & 2nd-run features.

115.name: TIFF Bell Lightbox
115.formatted_address: 350 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3X5, Canada
reviews: I was fortunate enough to attend TIFF..In conversation with Taylor swift! The best thing ever happened to me, I love TayTay & had been waiting from so long to see her & FINALLY❤️ I loved the theatre, audio-visual were on point & made a great experience for attendees.

This location has multiple screens for large showings (250 or so) to some smaller theatres that seat 20 viewers.  The staff and volunteers here are very friendly and always look forward to the big September festival that brings a worldwide cast of talent to showcase their goods for all to enjoy

The movie selections are really good as movies which don't get released elsewhere are present here. Members also get to watch movies for free too and the price of a ticket is also very affordable as well. Definitely make a trip to watch international acclaim movies without fail.

First time in and loved the ambience and the screening rooms. Quite spacious and friendly ushers to direct you as needed even if it's just getting to the restroom. Not privileged enough to get into the lounge so had to settle for the smaller cafeteria experience. Gift shop offered many TIFF assortment of purchase options and very informative staff. Very clean, well maintained.

editorial_summary.overview: This centre of the Toronto International Film Festival features world cinema & events year-round.

116.name: Cineforum
116.formatted_address: 463 Bathurst St, Toronto, ON M5T 2S9, Canada
reviews: Came here on a Wednesday to see Metropolis, and it was one of the most unique experiences I’ve ever had in Toronto. The theatre is set up in Reg’s living room - there’s a huge screen and a ton of cool decor. Reg does a talk at the beginning and during the intermission of the movie - mostly about his life and experiences in the industry. If you’re expecting an in-depth analysis of the film, that’s not what this is, but you will get his pov on some of the main themes.  Reg composes his own score for the movie - intermingling the new music with the film music - so if you’re looking to watch with the original audio, keep that in mind. The new score definitely added to the unique experience.  All in all, I’d recommend Cineforum if you’re looking for a interesting movie-watching experience in the city. It wasn’t my cup of tea, but I’m really glad I went!

Reg Hartt is a Toronto original. His stories are entertaining and engaging and the movies he shows are wild. His talks are a treat too. His home is full of curios and weird stuff to look at, and he is a friendly guy. Worth checking out for a unique experience. Byob

This is the best cinema in Toronto. Intimate and lovingly curated. Not fancy, maybe a little worn, but done proper. Reg Hartt is a tyrant (he will kick you out if he feels you don't deserve to be there), but he is the most knowledgeable person in the business. This theatre is an institution and a gem of the city.

As an American (United States) who for most of my life lacked real urbanite experiences and whose exposure to certain necessary "counter-cultural" experiences has been sadly limited, I will say the following.  The one time I took in a movie viewing at The Cineforum was some time in maybe 2010 or 2011 after returning to Toronto from which I had moved away after living there for 5 years.  "Don't it always seem to know that you don't know what you've got 'til it's gone?" sang Hartt's fellow Canadian Joni Mitchell.  Or in this case...Don't it always seem to know that you don't know what you got until you move away?  I honestly thought, the one time I went to CineForum, that Mr. Hartt was a little strange although fiercely intelligent, but now I think that it was my lack of understanding of him that prohibited me from being more comfortable in the experience.  My guesses about his brushes with the law are that they were generated probably by some people who consider him a threat to a status quo that doesn't deserve to remain a status quo.  From my (limited) understanding of his aesthetics and platform, he dares to question the politics and culture that dominate over controversial subjects, calling us to question our assumptions about those controversial subjects.
