Needlessly to say - we did his job for him and suffered through the night from his and his colleagues’ poor service. Food tasted mediocre. Nothing special and nothing terrible. Atmosphere was loud. Loud music and not many patrons. Surprised service was still so bad considering it wasn’t busy at all. Won’t be back unless I have to.

editorial_summary.overview: Sleek, upscale chain serving gourmet burgers, global comfort food, cocktails, wines & beers.

245.name: Horseshoe Tavern
245.formatted_address: 370 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2A2, Canada
reviews: As a concert-goer, the legendary Horseshoe Tavern has been a significant part of Canadian musical lore. You have to go to one of the famous venues with the checkerboard floors!  Opened in 1947, it has gone through various changes and had tons of influential acts played here. Lots of bands started here first and became pretty big like The Tragically Hip, Our Lady Peace and Blue Rodeo. This venue has been captured in a few songs (like Bobcaygeon - The Tragically Hip) and books as well.  It is a very intimate venue with the front bar open 7 days a week and live music and events in the back bar. You do have to walk through the front of the Tavern and pay the entrance fee/concert price to get to the back and watch the band. There is a little bit of seating and standing room in the front that houses a capacity of 400 people. Do expect blocked views if you're seated. However, you can still hear the band up at the front of the bar. Lots of great concert vibes!

Went here for a concert for the first time last night. It is a cool place with an interesting and historic atmosphere. But as a concert venue I didn’t like it at all. There is limited seating towards the back with narrow tables for drinks etc and then a dance floor type area between that and the stage. Lazy people like me want to sit and enjoy some good music. But the ambitious people want to stand in front of the stage which almost totally blocks the view of those seated.

THE place to be if you want to have an intimate experience with  live music at a small venue.  They have a bunch of sitting area with tables right behind a standing area in front of the stage.  Saw many bands here and many more to see in the future.  $7.50 for a pint of Shocktop ( front bar with super professional veteran bartender )  $10.50 for a tall can of Woodhoue IPA THE place to be if you want to have an intimate experience a live music at a small venue.  Like that they have a bunch of sitting area with tables right behind a standing area in front of the stage.  Saw many bands here and many more to see in the future.  $7.50 for a pint of Shocktop ( front bar with super professional veteran bartender )  $10.50 for a tall can of Woodhoue IPA  No debit.

Chill bar during the day with an extension and live events in evenings. Free pool during the daytime most days i think? 1 Pool table in Fantastic condition. Fair drink selection with fair prices. Bathrooms are well used but hey, it's on Queens.  Highly recommended.
Just the feel you get when you walk in the door is exlerating. So many big names have walked the same floor you have. The history on the walls and in the green room tells all.

editorial_summary.overview: Unpretentious front bar with pool table, plus a historic back room with local & touring music acts.

246.name: Reposado Bar & Lounge
246.formatted_address: 136 Ossington Ave, Toronto, ON M6J 1R5, Canada
reviews: What a vibe! We got seated within 10 minutes on a Friday at 9pm to a indoor high top seating. Host and waitress were both super friendly. The band was unbelievable and we easily had a smile on our faces the entire night. Great tequila selection and excited to come back!

Margaritas and empanadas were good, and the lady bringing the food was super nice (that's why I'm giving 2 stars and not 1). Guy behind the bar (we sat at the back patio) really had an attitude, as if he was doing me a favour and really didn't want to deal with me, making rude comments with sarcasm every time I went to the bar to order. It was the first time in my life that I was annoyed enough to give a $0 tip. I wish you guys well but I won't be coming back.

My sister and I hosted a farewell party here last weekend on Dec 3. This was an important event to us as my sister is moving away overseas at the end of the year. Deciding on this bar was truly the worst decision, and I’d recommend that anyone contemplating going to this bar to strongly reconsider. There were a multitude of issues:  1. The music level in the adjacent room was extremely loud, yet we were asked to keep our music level down. This makes absolutely no sense and when I asked very directly about this, the female bartender was extremely rude and didn’t provide an adequate response or rationale for the discrepancy I pointed out. I asked to clarify this with the bar manager and she wouldn’t call him for me. She asked me to go find him myself? How am I to figure out who the bar manager is? I have never met them before. Unbelievable.  Further, other people asked the same question and she was just as rude when communicating with them. She literally just said “yup” to one person who asked her “why is that the other/next door room can have the music louder?” Very poor etiquette/service standards for an establishment that is offering a social setting/event services to abide by. Take your guests more seriously and be interested in how to make their experiences in your bar the best they can be.  2. We requested a specific amount of guacamole and chips with a coordinator (Sandy) by way of email. My sister sent an email directly to him outlining this. However, when we got to the bar and let the bartender know, she was again dismissive and said that your bar only had 4 guacamole/chips left. Totally dismissive of the fact that we had placed the order in advance. Poor communication and coordination.  3. We requested a knife to cut a cake that I had brought to celebrate the promotion/farewell, and were told that the bar had no knives. A bar with no knives to provide upon request to its guests who have paid a decent amount to host an event there? This is bizarre and again in line with the inadequate and rude service I explained above. Take your role and service a bit more seriously and genuinely be interested in your guests’ experiences! We were forced to cut the cake with a plastic butter knife that we thankfully had brought with us.  Completely abhorrent and inadequate bar standards. Truly put a bad taste in our mouths. No proper response from the bar on this matter, and since the date of the party, have heard from many of our friends about the rude service they received.

I hosted a farewell party in their private room just this past weekend. There were a number of issues and I’d really advise against booking any sort of event here.  Firstly, their bartenders and staff were extremely unprofessional and rude. Staff were immediately rude upon our arrival for no apparent reason. Party had not even started, yet we were treated like they could not be bothered with any of our minor questions.  Further, they couldn’t even accommodate our simple request for 6 guacamole and chips which I had sent over in advance and was assured that the order would be communicated/submitted. We also asked to use a knife to cut a cake (also requested in advance) but we were literally told that this bar had no knives to spare?!  Ridiculous. We had to look for a knife and thankfully found a plastic butter knife.  All of that to say, this is probably the worst and least accommodating place to host an event. DO NOT BOOK THIS PLACE.
Our group had an amazing night! Great vibes in the bar. Someone in our group left an item behind and the owner was extremely helpful in getting it returned. Highly recommend for a fun night out!

editorial_summary.overview: Chic, dimly lit watering hole dedicated to top-shelf tequilas, plus Mexican tapas & live music.

247.name: Lula Lounge
247.formatted_address: 1585 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1T9, Canada
reviews: The prix fixe menu on discount day was worth the money. I would not say so as much on a full price day.  If you are looking specifically for a Latin club with dinner, it is a good choice and the event manager seems really nice.  If you are looking for a Latin club primarily, there are better options.  This would have been a 3.5 star, but I was billed for an Espresso I ordered and never received because their machine was broken, yet it never came off the bill. I did not notice until returning home and reviewing the receipt.  Not a big deal, but still...

Girls night out was a success at Lula lounge. The atmosphere and staff was welcoming. We went here for dinner and dancing, we made reservations a week earlier. Food was delicious and our waiter Dave was amazing and recommended his favourite dishes. Live Band and DJ were awesome. The place was packed but enough space to move and dance. (Nice Cooling Dance floor if you get super heated from dancing) Shout out to the security crew, they have a great team who operates the front. We will be back thank you for the great service and good music!

I paid 100 cad for a Mexican dinner, but it had only the name. My friends who were Mexican did not like it either, as it was not the preparation they had told me. The live music is very good and the dance classes too. Nice ambiance but the food was disappointing. I only recommend it for dancing and drinking industrial beer.  The servers were very friendly and the service was very good.

Had a great dinner and dancing experience. With the new food vendor at the restaurant, the food was exceptional!  The house fish with salad was fantastic and the consume was delicious. Live music salsa band playing Friday and Saturday makes for a great dinner, show and dancing experience.  Great for dates too although loud music makes it difficult to talk much.

An establishment that can shine with a few improvements.  Gotta provide better service. Staff were not very well trained. Service was slow and frustrating. Asked 3 different waitresses to clear the table. Took 30min to get that done.  Poor selection of wines and corkage was refused even though the gentleman at the front door had told me that they do provide that service.  Food was mediocre, their signature dish which was the short ribs came out cold. Best dish was the quac.  Slight improvements here and there can really up this place. Wish I could buy this place and transform it. But, understanding the type of crowd this neighborhood attracts, maybe I was expecting too much.  Best wishes.

editorial_summary.overview: Local & international acts for salsa, jazz & world music plus Latin dining & dancing on weekends.

248.name: El Convento Rico
248.formatted_address: 750 College St, Toronto, ON M6G 1C4, Canada
reviews: Finally a place with good music, fair prices, nice staff. The drag show was fun. It was a bit crowded, but the place didn’t get boiling hot which is great! You will see all ages which is great. Definitely would be back.

I rarely leave a review but I definitely had to. I had such a great time this past Friday. I booked a booth for 10+ people (highly recommended). All staff went above and beyond. A special shout-out to the bus boys and our server Erika!!!. They all made our experiment a memorable one.  We will definitely be back!
The drag show was good, however the place was to packed and to hot inside. I was hoping to have more salsa and not only reggaeton

I have been attending this gem for the last decade and have always seen familiar faces and always felt welcomed. This place is filled with great staff including Melanie and Paolo. Both of these staff members make this place what it is in customer service and are the reason why I continue to come and always invite my friends and family. Jezabel is an incredible host and a great MC. She truly is a queen that deserves the crown year round. DJ Flames kills it every set and makes this place pop. I'm saddened to here that Paolo isn't there and I'm hoping that this is temporary as I would like to see him there behind the bar with a smile that can light up the whole room and the tentative and great customer service that he brings to the establishment. Everyone please check this gem out and ask for Melanie and Paolo.

Ever since coming to Conventos, I never desired to go to any other clubs in Toronto. I feel safe here. It does get very crowded, I recommend come earlier because the lines tend to get very long even by 10:30 p.m, but aside from that they play dance music which I love comparison to other clubs that mainly play trap music. Always good vibes here. Highly recommend it for any occasion!

editorial_summary.overview: Happening Latin nightspot featuring drag performances,  DJs & Friday night dance lessons.

249.name: The Emmet Ray Whisky Jazz Bar
249.formatted_address: 924 College St, Toronto, ON M6H 1A4, Canada
reviews: Great music and atmosphere! Drinks were great, and food was exactly as expected, definitely a step up from pub food. I had the absolute pleasure of seeing the Julia D’ascanio Sextet and they blew me and everyone else in the room away. Such a great spot for live music. Staff was super friendly and charming!

If you ask a stranger, it’s a jazz bar. But ask even a semi-regular, and they’ll tell you the Emmet Ray is so much more than that.  The venue is deliberately designed to feel like a lounge room. The best way to experience it is by relaxing into one of their many comfy chairs with a glass of your favourite drink, ready to see something spectacular. A dedicated local community guarantees this harmonious attitude, making it feel more like a great café than a stuffy club. They might operate on a first-come, first-serve basis, but even if you’re standing in the wings, you’ll be able to hear and see everything.  It was my first time to visit and I came across this hidden gem while searching for a live jazz venue, my call was answered by Tom who’s knowledgeable and has a welcoming voice that calls you in, he was the one who also met us at the door when we arrived, the reservation is made through an email sent to Andrew who was not available during our visit but he responded immediately to my reservation request email with detailed explanations on everything we need.  We were served by Jane and Mike, both are a true reflection of high ethics and understand the art of customer service, they both checked on us several times and did everything they can to make sure we are having a wonderful experience.  The live band is a bomb, the music they composed and the way they play their instruments must be seen as no words will describe it fairly.  We ordered their signature salad, tomato soup and their Emmet Burger with fries, a unique flavours that no way I can express in writing.  They charge $10 per person to support the local band which I personally find reasonable and fair however I suggest they waive it in the future for kids.  Their washroom is located in the basement and it was super clean and tidy.  Overall, this is a place that must be seen and visited and it is an icon here not only in Toronto or Ontario but in Canada.  Thanks Emmet Ray team, keep the hard work going on.

My second or third time out. Very cozy. Food is outstanding. Great drink choices, including quite the selection of whiskey. All staff, from everyone in the kitchen to wait and bar staff, are super nice and go out of their way to take care of you. This venue is an hour away for me, by transit, but we'll worth it.

In my opinion this is a hidden gem in the neighborhood, though perhaps a well-known one to the locals. Good vibes, relaxed atmosphere. The food was surprisingly good and a great array of whiskeys and beer. Jen and Andrew saw to everyone's needs, were really attentive, and both seem to also be having a good time.

Food was average. But the service and jazz was great. Our server, a Scottish lad made the evening a ton of fun. He Recommended many great whiskey and scotch options that we loved. Whiskey menu was impressive. Prices fair. Will return.

editorial_summary.overview: Hangout with a long whisky list hosting a wide range of live bands, plus pub food.

250.name: Velvet Underground
250.formatted_address: 508 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2B3, Canada
reviews: Going to see Memphis May Fire in July was my first time visiting the Velvet Underground and I have nothing negative to say. I felt safe entering as they did appropriate security checks. The bar was clean and had a nice layout for a concert venue. The large basement was a nice place to be able to get a breather, go to the washroom and then get back to the show. There is a parking lot not far from the bar itself to be able to park for long hours, $19 covered our parking for the entire day into the evening right off Queen. As visitors from out if town, we liked the location as we were able to walk about and do shopping, grab dinner and still walk over and get in line for the venue. All the employees were really friendly. I guess the only downfall was the price of drinks at the bar, including water bottles at $4.00 a bottle. But I get it, it's a venue, you got bands playing, people are gonna pay, make your money! Lol. I would most definitely return for another venue in the future if a band I like goes there. As long as it's worth the 8 hour drive for me!! Memphis May fire, rain city drive and from ashes to new was absolutely worth it 😛👍

Friendly staff, great venue for small intimate concerts. The drinks prices are understandably a little high, but more reasonable compared to other venues I've gone to. Saw Joey Pecoraro here tonight in concert and I had a wonderful time. Would definitely come here again for another concert.  It's pretty easy to find and parking in the area was conveniently located too.

Attended a concert here. Lining up experience could have been better managed / signed but the venue was nice. Sound was amazing and security was helpful. Concert lighting was incredible and so were effects. A cozy venue that had the potential for a fantastic vibe when the music is right.

My wife and I saw Wilderado play at The Velvet Underground and it was a great experience!  Once you get through the front doors, you are greeted with a dark and exciting music venue.  We made our way to the front, with a drink, and soaked up some wonderful (and loud) live music from a band we really enjoy.  It felt very personal and intimate, and the crowd was equally enjoying the experience with us.  Thank you!

doesn't look like much from the outside but this is actually a great venue. The staff were attentive and friendly. The sound is great, and the sitelines were wide open. I should mention, I took my daughter to an all ages show, she had the time of her life!

editorial_summary.overview: Nightclub where DJs spin & bands play alt-rock alongside found-metal angel sculptures.

251.name: bar244
251.formatted_address: 244 Adelaide St W, Toronto, ON M5H 1X6, Canada
reviews: Terrible and unsafe.  Went for New Years Eve, which was supposed to be a ticketed event. Purchased 6 tickets on club crawlers before and got to the club around 11. Line was on wrongside and wasted 20 minutes after they made everyone shift to the other side. Bought tickets thinking that it would be better than a place which was open access and could get crowded. But in line they were letting mostly everyone in (with and without tickets) and the place was filled to the point that you couldn't move freely upstairs. People were packed so tightly that it was definitely a fire/stampede risk environment and certain men took advantage of the zero personal space situation (grabbing and touching my female friends and I inappropriately). Coat check was full so we had to carry our jackets and we wasted time after midnight waiting for drinks downstairs that we never got because they ran out of glasses. Bought two shots of rum at the other bar upstairs for $15 and left asap when it reached the most crowded that you couldn't even dance or breathe.  Overall, it was a horrible first experience at bar 244 and hated the hour we spent there. They were still letting people in as we left. Extremely unsafe environment and do not recommend women to go here, especially for NYE.

It used to be $3 all night, every night for bar rail, which is reasonable (cause honestly, bar rail is bottom of the barrel). Went tonight and Bud Light was $9.25, like.. are you serious? lol. Also, the downstairs club (one of the best parts) doesn't even open anymore??? The best club to go to years ago, and now they've sold out for expensive drinks, and shoving people in the top, and small, space. Lame. Won't go back.  Edit: I will say, 244 used to be my regular place, I loved it. Sure, no cover but if you made a guestlist and showed up before 11pm, you wouldn't have to pay cover anyway. I would have happily paid ten bucks for things to be at least a little similar to how it used to be, what made the place so great. Bartenders told us ALL beer was the same price, which contradicts what is said below.

drinks not even that cheap. worst dj ever - playing constant jamaican songs. overselling tickets and creating a dangerous environment. one loud muffled speaker upstairs and thats it.. really need to renovate the place.
This is a local watering hole with a dance club downstairs. Upstairs there is no cover with music. Good service at the bar.

Nice place -opens after 9 and crowd comes in after 11 -experienced both the non crowded and crowded moments -fun all through! No food -just a bar and dance joint though most nights the underground part is closed ..great bar tenders-parth served us well and the ladies were all smiles too all night despite the crowd

editorial_summary.overview: Nightspot with 2 levels: a main floor bar with casual food & a lower-level club where DJs spin.

252.name: Parlour
252.formatted_address: 270 Adelaide St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1P6, Canada
reviews: Nice atmosphere. Artists bring the crowd. However low A/C and ine bartender thought they were slick and didn't give me my change. Common ethics to always return that. This is the real reason why I made this review. Sorry lady, you shouldn't have thought I was intoxicated.
Great music nice outdoor patio even on a chilly night. Loved the intimate setting inside. Staff inside not friendly no smiles from anyone. Bouncers we’re nice outside. May try it again.

We came here for a party with friends and it was great! Music was awesome while the place wasn’t packed at all. Then we tried to book a table on our own and didn’t get a response for a week! Their Instagram says “dm to reserve a table”. I dm’ed and got a quick response that someone will reach out via email. Nothing. I followed up and got the same response. Still nothing. Then I sent an email to them instead of waiting for them to reach out to me. A few days later, the night before the party (!), I finally receive a templated email which I had to wait for a week?!! At that point, we already had other plans. It was a very unprofessional treatment from the Booking Manager. If the business says “dt to book a table” then be respectful to actually timely book your customers and not make them wait for a week. As much as I liked my first visit and wanted to introduce more friends to Parlour270, this unprofessional experience just ruined it all.

I visited this business with my wife for a drink for our anniversary.  I accidentally hit with my shoulder another guest while dancing and apologized for it. As a surprise he brought the bouncer and asked him to kick me out. The guest started grabbing me  from my hands basically wanted to fight  with me  while the bouncer being present and not doing anything I was forced  to leave so I didn't make a scene in front of my wife.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL

I went to this place only once. The interior design is very good and stunning. They have two big hall and patio as well. Their music is not the best and it wasn’t my taste and I was wondering with playing good songs this place can be amazing for Friday/Saturday night. We got bottle service and it was pretty pricy. I think this place is good for having parties and they do that too, because when we were there it was a group of people getting ready for birthday party.

editorial_summary.overview: Speakeasy set in the basement of a 1895 rowhouse, with exposed-brick walls and red velvet curtains.

253.name: La Porte Resto & Bar
253.formatted_address: 214 Ossington Ave, Toronto, ON M6J 2Z7, Canada
reviews: Really dope atmosphere! I attended a party called #fridaynightlights  and I had a blast. Cover for females is free before 12. Drinks are pretty cheap tequila shots $4. The bartenders are little baddies 😍. Security is cool. The crowd is pretty hot from men to women 👏👏👏

Had my birthday party there on Saturday September 17th 2016. I had the most amazing night. Owners are amazing.  Music is out of control amazing and the service is all round 5 stars if I could give more stars I would. A place you have to visit.

Best place to hit up on the weekends! Best music/ Djs, great crowds, no drama and great prices on drinks. Don't be fooled if you find the place dead before 11, once the clock hits 11:30 the place is packed. Definitely my go to place for a great Saturday night.
Good time, good music, good crowd and staff is cool too. The tacos are the best in the city! Cheap for the quality you're getting. Absolutely delicious. I'll go back just for the tacos.

It's always a celebration every time me and the girls get together here ! Going on three years, this is our spot. Tacos all night. With music and my fav drink ? It's a wrap :) thanks for always showing us a great time Trev!!!

editorial_summary.overview: Hopping, trendy nightspot with hip-hop DJs, dancing & bar bites like poutine served till late.

254.name: The Lounge at the Drake Hotel
254.formatted_address: 1150 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1J3, Canada
reviews: Reuben sandwich was delicious. Service was very good. Beautiful spot. Only complaint is they do not have a handle on the yellow jackets/bees out on the patio, a bit of a nuisance. Burger and eggs Benny both enjoyed by others. On the pricier side, but tasty.

Really neat place to grab a drink, whether you're staying at the hotel or just bar hopping in Toronto. Very stylish and considered one of the trendiest places. Prices are decent, perhaps a bit high, for the cocktails.

Great outdoor patio right on Queen Street. It's a bit pricey or but definitely worth trying some time at least for a cocktail! The staff are all very nice and the outdoor patio is very big especially with the expansion on to the street. They also have brunch and breakfast which I have yet to try! The patio itself is accessible and there are some umbrellas to protect in case of rain.
I enjoyed my experience here, the service was great. They brought us the brunch surprisingly fast on a Sunday morning. The cocktail was really nice.

Lovely atmosphere with cute decor. Can get a bit loud as there is an event venue on the floor below. Food is delicious and well presented and prices are in line with what you'd expect with a place like this.  Service for me was exceptionally slow (over an hour for main course to arrive and even slower to get our finished plates picked up). That being said, without even bringing this up to the staff, they apologized and gave us free dessert which was really nice, especially since it was unprompted. I imagine my experience is very rare and the staff's response to it is definitely a positive lasting impression.

255.name: Century
255.formatted_address: 580 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1M1, Canada
reviews: 3.75*  Chill club with friendly, young patrons.  The door guy, Phil, stood out as an employee in a good way and was understanding and easy going. The promoters were also nice and relaxed… to the point where you can’t even tell they are promoters and trying to sell and push products. I believe one of them was Michael.  The bottle girls are quite rude— if I had a dollar for every time I was pushed, I’d be able to afford a booth. Maybe if you’re a rich guy who tips well, you’ll get good service 🤷🏻‍♀️.  Pretty good music and functional floor layout. Would recommend!

Let’s be honest, most people with something great to say doesn’t usually walk away and think “I want to leave a google review tonight”  Without discrediting the negative experiences others may have had - they had their own motive for posting.  Century is amazing! This club is lit. I can guarantee, you will always have a great time in this establishment - they care about their staff and especially their customers.

My girls and I went here yesterday for the first time and it was an amazing time! The bouncers and the staff right when you enter was really nice! Music and vibe was on point! Definitely would come again.

Went on a Friday night and we got there around 11:00pm-ish. Staff and bottle girls were friendly, but DJ was meh. It’s really tough to move around in there. It’s just booths next to small paths, so later in the evening it’s just jam packed with people shoulder-to-shoulder trying to get from the washroom to the dance floor. That being said, the dance floor is extremely small, with a booth pretty much taking up most of the space. At around 12:30am the bouncers wouldn’t let anyone outside to smoke… I don’t know if that’s a usual thing, but at that point we just left.

Worst experience with the bouncers. They were very rude the second they didn’t see a Canadian ID. I have been accepted to every LCBO, dispensary, and multiple clubs around the same area. I did not show a fake ID, but the bouncers did not even bother to read it as they immediately saw it had another language. I immediately provided a scan of my passport, along with a VALID ID. I asked why my ID wasn’t valid, thinking it couldn’t have been because it’s international, due to this club being popular in one of the most cultural and diverse cities. In no description for the event did it say it was needed to bring 2 pieces of ID, and when I asked why it wasn’t on the event description, given Halloween is a very popular event attracting many international people, the bouncer said  “Well it’s not legal, so we don’t have to, sweetie”. When I spoke to the person in charge, he asked me “How are we supposed to know this is valid?” And said that putting this information was “Not required by the law” Even though my ID, both valid and not expired, has an official government stamp. On top of this, I paid a fee, for an event that did not even bother to have full detail. I’m upset, and would preferably like a compensation or just a suggestion that, if you’re going to be located within a diverse and multicultural city, start implementing acceptance to other IDs, train your bouncers  to be kinder, and at least take the time to put all information for international people on your event information.

editorial_summary.overview: DJ'd tunes & room to dance offered in a club decked out with a mix of street art & antiques.

256.name: Early Mercy
256.formatted_address: 540 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1M3, Canada
reviews: Early mercy is a late night club/bar. It has good music, it doesn’t get busy until after midnight. There’s no cover if you go earlier before midnight. Great place to go with friends or have a girls night! Thank you!

Enjoyed my first time there. It had the nice ambience and played some great music. Decided to go there again and hoping it would be a pleasant experience. Everything was great until my phone got stolen and it ruined my experience there. Not sure if there had been any theft cases in the past but it truly sucks.

Went for a work function to a private event last week. The entire staff was super attentive, but the girl with the pink her was a total rockstar. Great attitude and always willing to help out. Food was amazing too, so we’re the cocktails 🍹. Will be back

Probably had more fun in the GTA 5 nightclubs.  Bouncers are the dismissive, arrogant types. They simply suck, other reviews corroborate this.  Music is god awful. Most uninspired club music I ever heard. Awful music made it hard to dance, and few people were dancing even when we left after 3am on a Saturday night.  Bartenders were nice, which gets it 2 stars, though drinks are somewhat pricy and their card machines are annoyingly dated.  The average age of the people there is roughly late 20s, early 30s. I wouldn't go if you're under 25; vibes felt off.  I'm sure this place is more fun for the older crowd, but there are definitely better clubs to go to.
Low-key dance venue, gets alive at midnight, nice crowd, good service. $20-mixdrinks only, no classic cocktails. Works for an afterparty

editorial_summary.overview: Trendy bar featuring a dance floor & table service, available for events, parties & dinners.

257.name: Reverie at the Park
257.formatted_address: 569 College St, Toronto, ON M6G 1B2, Canada
reviews: Dylan! You are an amazing chef. Loved all the food I ordered today. Definitely will come back again. The bartenders are knowledgeable and make the whole experience of visiting Reverie that much more exciting.

This place does not take cash and tells you so after they mix the drinks. Hey, but they do take cash tips! They have two zombie hostesses to greet you when you arrive...not sure if they had a pulse. Need a new DJ. I won't be returning...totally weird vibe. I guess they don't check IDs either cause half the place needed their diapers changed.

From the delicious wine, to the eclectic and thoughtfully presented dishes, my friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Reverie! We couldn't decide what to order and opted to go for the tasting menu. Each dish was distinct; the chef incorporated Asian, Indian, Mediterranean, and American flavors which did not disappoint. The service was relaxed and friendly. I will return here again (if not just for their amazing brussels sprouts and smoked beef tartar)! Thanks for a lovely and unique dining experience.

What a great find. We we're on a wait list for a nearby restaurant who suggested we go to another place for cocktails. Fortunately for us it had not opened yet. We saw this interesting place next door and we're welcomed in. Very ecletic decor, great background tunes, wonderful friendly service. Fantastic cocktails. We e liked it so much that after our meal at the other restaurant we came back for their deserts and of course more cocktails. Will be back to same their meal menu

Girls night out and of course we wanted to be somewhere pretty and unique.  Reverie at the Park was suggested. The place was beautifully decorated.  Words fail me as I don't quite know where to begin to  describe this restaurant.  You just gotta go and check this place out yourself. As far as the food is concerned, the dishes are tapas sizes to be shared amongst friends.  Here's what I enjoyed: Boneless chicken with pepper jelly.  Omg ... so tender, juicy and flavorful.  The pepper jelly was the perfect pairing to the chicken. Sansho broccolini.  This is the surprise of the night.  I am not a fan of broccolini, but this dish was bold in its taste.  I loved it very much. Smoked beef tartare.  The dish that brought us to this restaurant in the first place.  It came to us covered in smoke.  Great for boomerang!!! Grilled octopus.  A very nice tender dish that's beautifully presented with potato roses.  Very elegant. Miso cod.  Nice gentle tasting fish.  Yum. The service was on point.  You can request for drinks to be made to your liking.  The  server was happy to give suggestions. Great night out.  Highly recommended.

editorial_summary.overview: Dreamily decorated space serving internationally inspired, artfully presented dishes & cocktails.

258.name: Blnd Tger
258.formatted_address: 559 College St, Toronto, ON M6G 1A9, Canada
reviews: When it was open it was a very decent place to go have a drink and a good time. Right now it is temporarily closed for renovations but will be open very shortly in the coming months possibly by Late July or early August 2022

Horrible place, overpriced, bouncers at the front door are extremely rude and are power tripping, the only good thing about this place is that it is CLOSED NOW……..if I could give no stars I would do I had to give one star and the one star would be for the location that’s it

I used to frequent this place back in the day. The music was always good, it was just busy enough to be a fun night out. The staff has always been nice and, to tell you the truth, the bartenders sometimes overpoured the drinks (can’t complain, right?)  Recently, this place has turned into a bit of a dump, likely because of the sketchy crowds that have started to show up. The pat down outside is more aggressive than a strip search at the airport. The woman even checked inside my socks.

This place is good for the size! It’s a small dance club in Toronto, great staff and good drinks! About the few negative things I’ll have to say are, the DJ that was in the night we went needed a break and what looked like the owner came on to DJ and it was horrible! He should stick to managing the club and not DJing. The other issue is the super low level lighting everywhere. Also the “must” check you coats. You pay $20 per person to get in and you must check you coat and pay another $5 per coat to have them check in. A bit overboard!

Not sure why everyone is negative about this place... I think its by far the best bar to hit up on college street! Bartenders and staff seemed fine to me, I had a booth and service was great! I love the music and the way the bar is set up. Dance floor is the perfect size, booths are not so close together which made it even a better experience! I definitely will be coming back!

editorial_summary.overview: Energetic nightclub featuring a dance floor, booths, DJs, theme nights, arcade games & foosball.

259.name: NEST
259.formatted_address: 423 College St, Toronto, ON M5T 1T1, Canada
reviews: On top of the considerable entry fee the club had a brilliant policy of no card payments under $50. Don't worry though, there is an ATM! You'll just have to wait 10 minutes in a queue. The drinks were nothing to write home about. Prepare to pay $5 for having your coat hanged too.  With regard to the dance floor, the club is just too crowded. The music is alright but generally the same thing; your typical club disco. What doesn't help are the pointless sofas and chairs placed in the middle of the room, as if they intentionally tried to make less space.
Cool spot. Came in early on chill Sunday to check it out. Will definitely need to come again at later time. But I enjoyed listening to the music.
Honestly the vibes weren’t here. Great dj. Bottle service outfits are too much and tacky. Easy to get drinks from the bar. Bartenders are on point. Your better off going to

Drinks are expensive - $8 for a rail shot. If you're female, don't forget to ask for your free champagne bottle on Saturdays if you have to go here! One bartender refused to give us a glass of water, dating he only sells bottles at that time of night, but the bartender on the other side face it to us no problem after going to her. No credit card payments under $50, which is crazy, it's like they don't want people to spend money... Small venue that was only saved at certain parts sure to the fans. Middle is full of booths that take up half the area to dance. Music was ok at the beginning of the night then weird, slow, repetitive, and bad transitions for most of the rest of the night (2/3 of the time). 4 or 5 toilet stalls for females, 2 sinks. $4 coat check and they try to give you only $5 back! Why??? That's just wrong. Won't be going back.

So I was having a rough time as my wife left with the kids, and work was tough. I had been spending each night miserable at home until this past weekend I decided to check out Nest.  That’s when I found the Barcode Saturdays events, and I have to say, WOW!!! Bottle service was incredible, music was great, and the overall environment was just upbeat and made me feel good again! bless this place!!!! Definitely coming back for another round of party.

editorial_summary.overview: Internationally known DJs spin at this cavernous night spot featuring premium sound & light shows.

260.name: Luma
260.formatted_address: 350 King Street West 2nd Floor REITMAN SQUARE, Toronto, ON M5V 3X5, Canada
reviews: Stunning views, the friendliest staff, great service from Camilla our server. Good food. Three issues: steak well done instead of rare, sent back to be redone, threw the rhythm of group eating off. Second time perfect. Huge error on bill: charged for 3 bottles of champagne instead of 3 glasses. Ahem. Then on entry told their POS not working for credit - debit. Took out cash at ATM in TIFF lobby. Asked at end if working now, it was. Mixed.

We wanted to try a new seafood restaurant, and this came up on open table. The seafood was delicious and very creative. But the dish I came for (lobster) was  already sold out by 8.30pm which seems early for a restaurant that is open late. They gave us a range of free food to try as a makegood which was excellent so silver lining. I'd go back but we went on a quiet night so they closed early and we watched them put tables away around us as we ate. The staff and food were lovely but definitely not a place for "vibes"...

Bright and spacious location with a view of the CN tower! Very delicious plates. They stole my heart from the warm yummy bread served with a salted honey butter, to the octopus appetizer warm salad and the branzino fillet main dish. Just wish the server was a bit more knowledgeable in describing the dishes - the menu is not too large, so it shouldn’t be too hard. :) Nevertheless, we will be back to try their famous truffle fries.

Went for December 31st dinner. My partner got the surf and turf which was amazing. Unfortunately my risotto was way undercooked and crunchy. I was disappointed. Please try the grilled octopus. I had one tiny bite and when I looked up, my partner ate everything because it was charred perfectly. It was a nice ambience. It was cloudy that day so couldn't get a clear view of the CN. I would give them another try in the future. Maybe it will be 5 stars then 🤔😊

Over the weekend, we visited Luma. Their outdoor terrace is great to enjoy dinner with a city view. The servers were friendly and accommodating. The food was flavorful with well balanced ingredients. Also, they have gluten free options. Definitely recommending this place.

editorial_summary.overview: Airy dining room & lounge on the 2nd floor of the TIFF Bell Lightbox serving creative Canadian fare.

261.name: 8090Karaoke
261.formatted_address: Canada, Ontario, Toronto, Dundas St W, Second Floor邮政编码: M5T 1H3
reviews: Oh man amazing time! We were killing time between R&D for dinner and speakeasy late night and I’m so glad I picked this place to go to!  They take cards not just cash. There’s a minimum spend (food and drink) but you’re not limited on time or billed by time.  The machine was easy to navigate and easy to find songs we wanted.  We got a bottle of grey goose that came with mixers and just made our drinks in the room. Only funky thing is it was little Dixie cups for our drinks haha. No biggie.  Last note: my husband was confused about the random charges (2x $30) and unfortunately I told him too late that gratuity was probably already applied. So in future we won’t be adding a tip ontop a tip. =)  We had a really great night and would come back again as a result.

I was initially a bit thrown off by the reviews but it’s typically people who had a bad experience who are quick to leave a bad review. I actually had a great time here for a birthday celebration on a Friday night. The sound system was nothing to complain about. The mic died once on us, and after that they would come around to check if we needed a new one.  The karaoke interface was 3.4/5. There were plenty of English songs, but unfortunately some songs weren’t able to be added to the queue (but there were still lots to choose from). My group got the hang of the interface and you can always ask them to help if you’re having trouble. The AC was on blast when I first arrived and was much needed as the night went on lol. They don’t allow outside food since they have a kitchen. The french fries, fried squid and chicken karage were tasty. However, they did allow us to bring a cake.  Okay, cons: they only accept cash! This was not mentioned to me when I first called to book the room and it would have been appreciated if they did disclose this info. Luckily, I followed up with questions - so do your due diligence and ask them any questions you have. You can either start paying as you go or one bill at the end. There are major banks in the area should you need it. They had no problem with us leaving to use the local banks as opposed to their ATM (another review here said they didn’t allow them)  I truly hope they can fix their payment process for the sake of their visitors, but overall it was fun and it was nice to not have a time limit. We stayed from 9pm until normal closing, about 2:30am-ish. Happy singing! 🙂
Drinks were weak, but over all this is a great place to chill. Friends and I had a blast. They had most of the songs we were looking for in different languages, too! Great service!

I left a gift here. Called immediately and they said it’s gone and blamed the cleaners. They 1000% took the gift and kept it. Service was terrible and it’s $300 for a bottle of booze.  Some terrible folks working here.

The rooms are nicely laid out and presentation is inviting. Their karaoke system is by far the worst I have ever seen. I have been to truck stop bars with better song selection. The interface for song selection is abysmal and so is the sound mixing. Selecting songs is annoying because their interface prioritizes Chinese music over English. Other than that it’s pretty chill.

editorial_summary.overview: Clubby lounge with offbeat decor, private rooms & full bar including cocktails plus Asian snacks.

262.name: B Boss Ktv
262.formatted_address: 283 Spadina Ave. Suite 201, Toronto, ON M5T 2E3, Canada
reviews: Bring your physical ID And cash! This place is really not as bad as the reviews make it out to be. The snacks were tasty and tea pitchers were good. The rooms were cleaned because I could smell bleach and the mic’s and song choices were good. You can stay for as long as you want, just meet the minimum spend with food or drink orders which isn’t too bad. Compared to places that charge per hour if you stay longer it’s worth it. The staff don’t have the best English but they’re trying their best.

Horrible experience !!!!!!!!! We went yesterday, 12 people .. when they charge you ,they tell you one price plus “taxes” they said !!! but  actually they add $20 tip out on top of that and plus the taxes .. SO BE CAREFUL  “ !!!! …BECAUSE they  don’t mention anything if you don’t ask… they don’t explain anything , you ask questions and they look at you like you’re an alien or something .  10 songs are in English the Rest all in Chinese..  we left an hour later and they don’t even look at you !! Lol .. We went to this other place … ECHO KARAOKE. Much better 100 times organize and all the songs you want , air conditioner , amazing customers service and the drinks are so delicious!!!

I’ve been here 3 times. The first time was fine. The second time, I booked through a promotor and was told we would get 10% off. Then, the bill came and they said if we pay CASH, it’s 10% off. But the cash was never mentioned when booking through the promotor. This wasn’t that big of a deal, but my group was very unhappy about it and I agree that this was a miscommunication. But I decided to give them one more chance and booked again. When the bill came, they added an automatic service charge and also did not offer a 10% discount. But they said we had to pay in cash - so we had to go to the ATM to do this. Except oddly, they didn’t offer the discount like last time. When I asked, the guy just said “no discount. Cash only.” And I said “why? We paid with card last week.” after I asked why many times, he said the card machines are broken today. Essentially, I feel that the place is very inconsistent and has bad communication. It’s inconvenient to go get cash and to me it felt like they were not very empathetic or understanding of our confusion, which only made us frustrated. Had they said from the start “sorry our machines are broken today, so it has to be cash only.” It would have been fine. and maybe throw in a round of pop as a courtesy. then, it would’ve been simply accepted.  Karaoke wise, the place is good. Good rooms, clean bathrooms, lots of song selection. But the customer service from a business standpoint needs improvement.

Just awful.  Came with a group of friends and we were meeting others that were already there. Upon entering my one friend walked towards our friends we were meeting there. The bartender began yelling at him because he hadn't checked his ID yet. However, the bartenders English was not good, so my friend kept walking not realizing he was being spoken to. The bartender was very aggressive and continued to raise his voice until my friend ended up leaving because he was so shook up by the exchange.  We were all so appaled by this exchange that we would have left then and there, however the other members of our group had been there for a little while so we decided to stay to meet the minimum spend.  After ordering a few drinks we tried to pay our individual bills but the bartender then told us they can only do one bill. Ridiculous. He then followed this up by telling us it was CASH ONLY. There were no signs or any indication of this before we had ordered drinks.  Oh and they charged my friend $7 for a can of iced tea.  It was absolutely appalling service and rules this place had.  The machine was mostly in mandarin so it was very difficult to use even though the language setting was on English. Finally, the actual karaoke machines had a very limited amount of songs. I'm talking classic songs everyone knows and they were nowhere to be found.  Do NOT go here. I can't stress how awful this experience was. Likely just a money laundering set up, because I can't imagine any place like this running profitably and legally.

Friends invited me to come to this place. There is a Green P parking lot around the corner on Dundas (underground) The place has a good variety of finger foods to buy and a decent variety of drinks (alcohol & non alcohol), I was the designated driver so I had a pitcher of hot lemon drink🍋 and it was really good. The finger foods that was ordered was French fries and a great variety of some delicious Chinese dishes. Also very yummy. The karaoke machine has a variety of languages to choose from, pick your songs and sing away.  🎶🙂👍 We were here from 8:30ish until late into the night. We were in a group of ten people and the price at the end way very reasonable. 👍 Just my opinion on price because of the amount of people, the time, and the food and beverages. The service staff check in from time to time to help clean and serve you. They are also friendly and helpful. 😊 Place is clean but will get a little noticeably dirty because of food, beverages, amount of groups of people coming and going, but this is normal and acceptable, so don't be discouraged. Fyi, make sure to have some sort of picture ID. It is a must and you will be asked by security and staff when you first enter. The experience was great and fun. 😀 You want a fun time with friends or even work colleagues, I think you'll enjoy yourselves here. 😊👍

editorial_summary.overview: Comfort snacks & Taiwanese bites are offered with tea & juice in a lively bar with private rooms.

263.name: Escape Manor Toronto
263.formatted_address: 383 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1K1, Canada
reviews: Highly recommended place to pick for arranging team building events. Our team attempted for the Devil's Advocate Room and was almost there, though missed solving the last clue.  Different rooms have different themes but they all test your analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills.  Thanks to the Escape Manor team for providing a learning experience for all of us.

First time going to an escape room and I went with a friend. Total experience was amazingggggg. The thrill of the game (Devil’s advocate), the mystery, the hospitality from the staff, excellent. Glad I spent my New Year’s Day at Escape Manor. Will definitely be back for redemption cos my fried and I couldn’t escape, tho we found the contract😆. Thought it was a bit pricey tho but fun was had🙌🏾

Been here three times already and it has always been amazing! ❤️❤️  Tried their wine cellar, death row escape room and axe throwing. They all were super fun, for escape room go with a good crowd and you will have time of your life.  My favourite was the wine cellar, love the storyline and the experience, a must try. I would recommend going 30mins or even an hour early to just chill, play board games and have some drinks before your game. You can also order food, and you can also take the drinks in the room with you.

I've been here on 3 separate times now with friends to try out different Escape Rooms and even did a session of Axe throwing this last time around. Matt was funny, friendly and did an awesome job turning us into axe throwing experts. Fourth room is already booked and I can't wait to be back!

Went there for the power hour classic Axe Throwing experience with 2 of my friends. The trainer there was absolutely helpful with tips and tricks of how to throw and aim for the first time. I thought it was more so a “here’s how you do it” and be left alone the rest of the session but we ended up learning so many team building or competitive games to keep the fun going.  I ordered the Obituaries Delight as a refreshment and BOY OH BOY how I missed good drinks!! It’s great to see friendly staff and a coat rack - two things I appreciate the most. Overall I had a splendid time and can’t wait to head back again. Thanks Escape Manor!

264.name: Echo Karaoke& Bar in Dragon City
264.formatted_address: 280 Spadina Ave. 2nd Level, Toronto, ON M5T 3A5, Canada
reviews: Came here with a group of 12 and had a poor experience at this venue. The user interface for the karaoke machine was confusing and also hard to use as it wasn’t in English, and only some popular songs were available. The biggest concern here, a warning to future goers, is that there is NO air condition. The room would become very hot and the service was bad, to the point where we would have to bring the water pitcher out ourselves to get water for our room. Several times we would step out of the room to cool down and would see the staff just on their phones doing nothing, and not tending to our basic needs (especially if we’re paying $450). As frustration grew, we raised our heat concern to the front desk and the worker chuckled, not addressing our concern professionally. It feels as if this business is capitalizing on the lack of air condition to charge ridiculous premiums for basic beverages. Below is an image showing the prices of two cans of pop for $18. I would recommend any reader of this review to opt for literally any other karaoke bar in Toronto, as the premium price you pay here comes with poor service, unreasonable menu prices, and no air condition. Don’t come here.

The rooms are really nicely decorated and spacious, they were open until 3am. I had a party of 17 people and they tried to make us book a party room for $500, even though online on their website 17 people fit In a large room $350. So we showed them their online price and they ended up giving us a Party room for the price of a Large room, which worked out even better. The drinks were good and the music options were pretty decent, looking up music was a bit tricky, but we figured it out in the end. The A/C was broken when we went so it was really hot and that made it hard to really enjoy, but overall everyone had a good time. There's an ATM there to pay, they only take cash. Not too bad of a karaoke spot. I would go again with friends.

Garbage service and terrible staff members. They treated my brother on our sisters birthday like he's less than a rock. Cause he's so level headed they didn't get a real reaction. I wished it was me. What is it? Why treat people in such a fashion. The man already has one eye and they are throwing cards at people. 🤬🤬🤬

It was a nice place for karaoke but the staff members where very rude and not professional. One they seen me trying to talk to them but they continued to talk among themselves. While I was standing there they continued to make jokes and look in my direction to force me to believe they were talking about me. On top of all if it, I'm walking out the place, one guy threw a card at me as I was leaving. The other staff members laughed at it and didn't apologize. I don't want to pull a race card but I don't understand the level of treatment. I felt unwanted and provoked.

Cash only. Very old facilities. Machines have outdated songs and apparently the quality of the rooms vary within the same venue. Convenient location though for downtown dwellers. Of course it's cheaper if you go as a big group. Not sure if I'd personally wanna go back.

editorial_summary.overview: Karaoke & drinks spot in a mall, with private rooms plus a range of songs including Chinese tunes.

265.name: Lula Lounge
265.formatted_address: 1585 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1T9, Canada
reviews: The prix fixe menu on discount day was worth the money. I would not say so as much on a full price day.  If you are looking specifically for a Latin club with dinner, it is a good choice and the event manager seems really nice.  If you are looking for a Latin club primarily, there are better options.  This would have been a 3.5 star, but I was billed for an Espresso I ordered and never received because their machine was broken, yet it never came off the bill. I did not notice until returning home and reviewing the receipt.  Not a big deal, but still...

Girls night out was a success at Lula lounge. The atmosphere and staff was welcoming. We went here for dinner and dancing, we made reservations a week earlier. Food was delicious and our waiter Dave was amazing and recommended his favourite dishes. Live Band and DJ were awesome. The place was packed but enough space to move and dance. (Nice Cooling Dance floor if you get super heated from dancing) Shout out to the security crew, they have a great team who operates the front. We will be back thank you for the great service and good music!

I paid 100 cad for a Mexican dinner, but it had only the name. My friends who were Mexican did not like it either, as it was not the preparation they had told me. The live music is very good and the dance classes too. Nice ambiance but the food was disappointing. I only recommend it for dancing and drinking industrial beer.  The servers were very friendly and the service was very good.

Had a great dinner and dancing experience. With the new food vendor at the restaurant, the food was exceptional!  The house fish with salad was fantastic and the consume was delicious. Live music salsa band playing Friday and Saturday makes for a great dinner, show and dancing experience.  Great for dates too although loud music makes it difficult to talk much.

An establishment that can shine with a few improvements.  Gotta provide better service. Staff were not very well trained. Service was slow and frustrating. Asked 3 different waitresses to clear the table. Took 30min to get that done.  Poor selection of wines and corkage was refused even though the gentleman at the front door had told me that they do provide that service.  Food was mediocre, their signature dish which was the short ribs came out cold. Best dish was the quac.  Slight improvements here and there can really up this place. Wish I could buy this place and transform it. But, understanding the type of crowd this neighborhood attracts, maybe I was expecting too much.  Best wishes.

editorial_summary.overview: Local & international acts for salsa, jazz & world music plus Latin dining & dancing on weekends.

266.name: Club Paradise
266.formatted_address: 1313 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1P1, Canada
reviews: Do not pay a dancer up front. A dancer charged me 200 dollars and said it was for 30 minutes. After 10 minutes, she said it was over. She said I lost track of time. She got up and left the booth. I spoke to the manager and he said she would be fired. There was a scam but the management took it seriously, thus I gave a 2 star rating, not 1.
Management is half a sleep, some of the girls dont bother, the rooms dont have enough leg room for the dancers, why does this place exist?

Go to Lancaster. This place is grungy, dirty, the girls aren’t attractive or nice and the management and ownership don’t know how to run it. They’re are rude and racist. One of the managers himself (the penguin from 1960’s Batman looking one) stated that rap music is “monkey” music and doesn’t want it playing at the club. Spend your money and your time somewhere else. This place can rot.

They play music that u can vibe with, drinks are affordable and the girls are friendly, beautiful and  down to earth just know ur place and don't do too much and the security and manager are always making sure that ur having a blessed night

Its a small place dirty looking but the waitresses are friendly and hot. The strippers are all beautiful. One Romanian chic goes by name Daniela is the hottest one there. Very friendly and fun and well worth taking for dances, you wont be disappointed well worth the money

267.name: Jive Nation Toronto
267.formatted_address: 1573 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1A6, Canada

268.name: The Shop
268.formatted_address: 1566 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6R 1A6, Canada
reviews: The Shop is pretty lit, the night I went they had this group of DJ's called SLC (@slcszn on insta) they were doing this event and all the music was straight fire and the vibes were dope. The Shop offers bottle service and even tho it was packed there was still enough room for everybody to dance. The whole night was a viiibe fr fr
Amazing place  👌🏻

269.name: Sangria Lounge
269.formatted_address: 145 Roncesvalles Ave, Toronto, ON M6R 2K9, Canada
reviews: This is one of my favorite place along the Roncesvalles strip. I have been here a few times over the years and have always had a good experience. Now given the name, Sangrias are probably one of the main reasons you would come here and they are fantastic and well priced pitchers. If that is not your jam they are also an excellent cocktail bar. This is a great place on hot sunny day and I would highly recommend it.

The food and the service at sangria is amazing!! Our server Thalia was attentive, friendly, and provided amazing customer service. I appreciated that they care about their customers and wants everyone to have an amazing experience. If you haven't had their sangrias you are missing out. Excellent food as well!! We will be back soon!!
Love this place! We go at least once or twice per week.  Really nice food and great cocktail selection. Love it!  Would love to see a Trivia night or something. Would be great!

My experience here was beautiful, we ordered for red wine sangria and chicken wings and fries the drinks were a 8/10 because there wasn’t enough alcohol more fruit juice, which the fries were 10/10 crunchy and crispy. The wings were a 6/10 there was taste and flavour but not the best I had, fine for the price but also felt a little dry. The ladies running/ managing the place were lovely. Definitely a place for some drinks with friends

Had a great time at this place today. It's a real gem - the food and drink are affordable, and it's a wonderful space to sit and hang out with friends.  I reccomend getting a pitcher of the peach sangria, with red wine and an extra shot of peach schnapps. In a city that regularly charges 40-60 for a pitcher, Sangria lounge offers 20 bucks for a pitcher with a few extra dollars for a shot of additional alcohol. I went with 2 others, and we comfortably had about 2 glasses per pitcher.

270.name: Toronto Style Bar & Grill
270.formatted_address: 1546 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1A4, Canada
reviews: One THE BEST pub grubs I've had. The owners are very kind and considerate. You can just tell the food was made with love, best hot wings I've had in Toronto.

Nice atmosphere! Great bartenders, cheap drinks. Great menu but so far only had the medium wings but so damn good! Go Toronto Go ! UPDATE: 14/08/2022 Had the basmati rice and a side of 12 wings and Toronto Style Sauce and it was all great, see photo.

... this brilliant and unique bar embodies the 90's era Toronto Raptors purple and red aesthetic while honoring its own unique spin on bar cuisine. With a mesh of Indian and Canadian dishes, Toronto Style Bar & Grill is a trip.  Rainbow lights. Karaoke on weekends. Pool and darts available.  THE SWEETEST WAITRESS EVER.  ... I will be returning very soon.  Located near Keele Station, after getting lost in High Park, this experience was a beautiful surprise at the end of an amazing day.  Cheers. ❤️ 💜 🍺 🍻 🍺 💜 ❤️

Passed on this bar for years for its kitch-y exterior, and it was honestly a truly regrettable decision... And i do not live my life with much regret.  This bar is amazing. Small but mighty. Great service from friendly staff. It feels like home, with friendly patrons and inclusive activities.  The drinks and food are well priced, and this place is worth a visit if you enjoy a real bar free of edison bulbs, industrial style stools, neon signs that would say "Dont let me eat alone" or something like that. This is an honest and humble bar and you'll feel the warmth immediately!
Toronto Style hosted my friend's Halloween event and they were wonderful! The Halloween decor they put up was also great!!

271.name: Planet Paradise
271.formatted_address: 51 Winchester St A, Toronto, ON M4X 1P3, Canada
reviews: Awesome. The chef/owner was seriously awesome. I will remember this place forever. If you’re a stoner this is your own piece of paradise literally. Made some memories here with my fiancé and meet an awesome person. Will be back one day.
Great place. Great atmosphere. Lots of seating . Good snacks and most of all Great people.

My friend and I were sheltering from a heavy thunderstorm at Planet Paradise's front door on August 4, 2022, at 3:20 p.m. EDT. We had only been at the front door for 4 minutes when we were finding an uber to leave.  A man, presumably an employee or the owner, was extremely rude to us and basically forced us to leave their roof. His exact words were "this is a business, you have to move, move!"  We couldn't find any other shelter from the thunderstorm at the time, so we were forced to walk through it. This was a locally 30 to 50 mm thunderstorm, according to Weather Canada.  My friend was experiencing discomfort as a result of an underlying medical problem. Fortunately, she is feeling better now as I write this comment, thanks to proper treatment.  As a small business owner myself, I appreciate and support local businesses, but I must state that this is not the right way to do business, and it is certainly not the right way to treat people.  As such, we demand a formal and public apology from the owner of Planet Paradise.

My friend and I just came from there, we didn't know what it was about so we saw some people go inside and followed. There was a guy at the door with dread locs who stopped us, he said we couldnt come in since its a private bar with a very rude tone. When we asked how to be a member he also looked at us with a very "how can you not know" look and tone at the question and simply said go online, without even bothering to give us a website. He was extremely rude and had an attitude, seemed like he didn't even want to answer our questions. We are never coming back there. Please get better people to work at your establishment and I'm not the type of person to complain about everything but he was really rude.
Love this place. If you are able to be a good lounge user for cannabis and pay the fee without complaining and stay inside you should go here

editorial_summary.overview: Relaxed, cannabis–friendly lounge offering vape products, games, nibbles & Wi-Fi in a cozy interior.

272.name: 521 Cafe & Bar
272.formatted_address: 521 Danforth Ave, Toronto, ON M4K 1P7, Canada
reviews: Disgusting behavior from every worker in there. They treated us horribly.

Meh. The place must have seen better days. Tired furnishings. Prices are higher here for Molson beer than quality craft beer at nicer pubs nearby that also have more atmosphere. The good reviews cannot be legit and must instead be from a select community. During Euro 2020 no football on TV.
Had never been here but will defiantly come back... regularly.  Waitress was awesome and the owner ( I believe, and the bartender...all very welcoming )  Great music too!  Thank you

The coolest friendliest staff I have encountered in all of Toronto. Owner sociable and really seems to care for his staff. Good music and properly made drinks. The prices were great too! Would def come back
Been here a few times and the vibe is always great! Nice to have a spot on the Danforth open late. Get off work late and have a cheeky pint before heading home.

273.name: Billiards Academy & Sports Lounge
273.formatted_address: 485 Danforth Ave, Toronto, ON M4K 1P5, Canada
reviews: We had our work Christmas party at Billiards Academy...it was awesome. The place itself is spacious and accommodating. The billiards equipment and tables were excellent and in excellent condition. The owners and staff are efficient and courteous, kind and thoughtful. There was excellent service and continual tidy up and removal of empty drink and food containers. Overall I would give them an eleven ⭐ rating...but I can't so definitely 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟. Absolutely would go back, loved it.

Fantastic place to play pool. Reminds me of pool clubs back home. Love the boards. They take care of it and good place to spend time with friends. You can rent a board for an hour and it charges CAD 16+Tax

Ang and the team are absolute gems. Tables are beautifully balanced and well-kept, staff are friendly and the drinks are reasonably priced. Old school Toronto pool hall vibes with a new age feel. 10/10

Hello And My name is David normal customer at this establishment. I like to come here with my Friends and play some biliards and I have har nothing but great experiences here. I have met some new people here. I also recommend you come on a Tuesday or Wednesday because it is discounted great place !!!
This place is by far my favorite pool hall. Staff, amazing Lots of selections

editorial_summary.overview: Relaxed venue for drinks & pub grub including wings & burgers, with many pool tables & sports on TV.

274.name: Privé Hookah Lounge
274.formatted_address: 515 Danforth Ave, Toronto, ON M4K 1P5, Canada
reviews: Went on Sunday night and had the place to ourselves. The decor was such a vibe along with the music the bartender was playing, I was enjoying my time so much it was so relaxing! Shisha was also on point, we got watermelon and it actually lasted our whole session, no burn taste so that was pleasant. On our walk home we were already discussing when we should go back!

The establishment opened later than the listed time, and the owner rushed us out when his friend wanted our table, without warning. We had been spending money all night, truly a uniquely disrespectful experience.

Came specifically to try out this shisha place to find out there is no coconut charcoals available??! This is crazy. Also after I sat down at the table, the bartender didn’t bring out the menu, but rather returned back to the bar desk and kept minding his own business, while I was staring at the surroundings. I had to get up and leave at this point as it was too much of a disappointment already. Overall loved the vibe and abundance of cool neon signs, but service is apparently questionable. I would definitely give this place another chance, but due to the fact that they are not using coconut charcoals, I doubt I will come back here.
Such a great vibe , very professional and clean. The hookah was great! Definitely worth going there
Hospitality is crazy. A spot I'm definitely coming back to. Rare to see in Toronto.

275.name: Dine & Dim Asian Cuisine (粵點居)
275.formatted_address: 633 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M4M 1Y2, Canada
reviews: I have gone to this restaurant when it was Pearl Court and before the restaurant renovation when they used to have this real inexpensive Asian gem feel in the restaurant and served the food on carts. Don't get me wrong, I love the new vibe, but with the price increases on the food ($7 per dim sum item) it is hard to justify 5 stars for the restaurant now. The food is quality and the curry cuttlefrish got later after the reno and I really appreciate that. However, gone are the days of $30 for 2 people early bird dim sum pricing. On the new menu, highly recommend the sizzling platter (beef) - it is delicious!

Excellent quality dim sum. It’s going to be a new go-to spot for me! My favourite was the pan fried shrimp and chive dumplings, pictured below. Bonus ‘liminal’ atmosphere as you pass through the upstairs bar to the bathroom.

Overall good experience, interesting menu, cozy atmosphere. We ordered the Typhoon Mountain lobster, which turned out to be 2 deep fried lobsters covered in fries with sweet and sour sauce on top. Interesting combo of flavours, and pretty certain these were McCain fries. The bbq pork buns were great, lots of filling and the bread is very soft. And they had great spicy mustard that was amazing with hargow. Would come back and try more items on the menu.

Best dim sum place I’ve ever had!! I dined in for the first time here (usually I order take out) and it was amazing! Ordered way too much food but leftovers are always good 😍 The black pepper short ribs are my fave dish, melt in your mouth delicious! The ingredients are always fresh with chunks of ginger in it. I’d always wanted to try the green beans with minced pork and was not disappointed! Deep fried tentacles are always on my go-to order as well 🤌🏽 Service was great and pretty quick too. Pictured: Har Gow, Siu Mai, Deep Fried Octopus Tentacles, Black Pepper Short Ribs, Ginger Chicken & Pineapple.  Just fyi - sometimes takeout orders don’t come with sauces so just make sure you have some at home.  I will be dining in and ordering again for sure :)

I took my grandmother here for dim sum and we enjoyed it! It is one of the only places serving dim sum on this side of town and the food was excellent. It came out quickly and was fresh and hot. The har gow were generously stuffed with shrimp, siu mai were very tasty, and we really liked the shrimp rice noodle rolls. We tried the deep fried shrimp with salad and that was also perfectly crisp and flavourful. They had a lot of other lunch items on the menu and we also ordered the XO noodles, which were also delicious. The char siu baos could had a higher bbq pork to dough ratio, and I wish they offered a few other options like ham sui gok, wu gok, or bbq pork rice noodle rolls.  The ambiance and decor inside is more modern, clean, and well thought out than typical places I've visited.  The total was a bit more expensive than other places we've gone to in Chinatown but we didn't mind since it is the only place in the area, the food was good, and the decor was nicer than usual.  Other reviews and photos mentioned sushi, but that wasn't an option on the menu we were given today - we only saw dim sum or Chinese food as options.

editorial_summary.overview: Unassuming eatery serving dim sum during the day, plus a menu of Chinese dishes at night.

276.name: Tenjin Karaoke Bar
276.formatted_address: 633 Gerrard St E 2nd Floor, Toronto, ON M4M 1Y2, Canada
reviews: I really wanted to enjoy this new place seeing the positive reviews and photos, but the sushi rice was awfully hard for the maki and nigiri when we received our lunch order. The maki had way too much rice when the image reference had shown more of a 1:1 ratio as the traditional maki is done.  The sashimi was thickly cut and seemed fresh, while the oshizushi was flavourful, but after having the tuna maki - and seeing the rice - I couldn't help but think all the toppings were just used to mask the old rice. I don't mind too much rice with my sushi, but it has to be fresh at the very least!  Wasabi was also given in abundance, but based on the different colour on the outside and inside, we knew it wasn't very fresh either... All of these cues just left our stomachs feeling off for the rest of the day.  I would recommend this place for the sashimi and to satisfy an oshizushi craving, but I can't really vouch on anything else.

Found this gem sushi store during lockdown when they were still renovating and only providing takeout. They finally opened up last week! I can in on a Sunday evening and got myself one of their booth seat. The environment is great and the sushi is amazing! Absolutely in love with their torched scallop and salmon 🤤. Will definitely keep coming back.

We decided to check out Tenjin Karaoke spontaneously one night while walking home and are extremely happy we found this gem of a place. We've returned multiple times ever since and have recommended it to many friends for birthday outings or just a night out.  Always a fun atmosphere with reasonably priced drinks and some of the friendliest staff/owner. For nights where you want to go out to something more than a regular bar but not to a club, Tenjin's the perspect spot to visit. We definitely needed a venue like this in the east end.

Outstanding sushi restaurant out in East Chinatown. Love their torched ebi (shrimp) oshizushi, but my FAVOURITE is definitely the torched scallop sushi… so juicy, so flavourful!!!! Both are part of their torched sushi tray… worth the try!!!
Idk anything about their sushi, but the Karaoke was sick. They have a deal with wings and beer (3-4 people's worth) that's super fairly priced.

277.name: Writers Room Bar
277.formatted_address: 4 Avenue Rd, Toronto, ON M5S 2C7, Canada
reviews: I was told that it's been recently renovated. But I'll say that it's still a greatly designed space. The views of the Toronto skyline are amazing. The drinks are mixed well and fit the swanky atmosphere. We didn't come to eat, so I can't speak on the food. Drinks are a bit on the pricey side, but you are in the Park Hyatt, so just be prepared. Our bartenders were nice, and we had a great conversation. Would definitely come back.

Pricey cocktail bar in the Park Hyatt. Out of the three cocktails I tried, I really enjoyed two - I’m not a very sophisticated drinker but those just tasted good to me. Also the presentation was very pretty. The one I ordered for myself, the Age of Mass Culture - it just felt like I was drinking straight alcohol. Which may be what it is, I’m just not experienced enough to know! I think the value is reasonable but each cocktail is around $20, so it can get expensive.  Overall the ambiance is great, on a Thursday night around midnight there were a good number of customers and the patio is available for some pictures of the Toronto skyline. It was a nice experience but probably only for people who appreciate these finer cocktails!

It’s my third time having dinner at writers room. I’ve had great experiences before so this time I brought my friends from New York there.
