The view was still breathtaking, however, we were really disappointed with everything else. First, the service was extremely slow. We sat there for 1.5 hours without getting our main course so we checked with one of the servers and she told us our dishes will be served shortly. But it took 30 more minutes to come. The bar was half empty at that time so we didn’t know what made it that long. We were very patient at that time until our steak come. The first pictures shows the steak I had in May at writers room. It was very juicy and tender and it came with baked mini potatoes with special sauce. So I ordered it again this time. The steak in other pictures is what we got this time. It looks very sad and dry. Does it look like medium rare? Is that even steak? It tastes like beef jerky. Also, it came with fries instead of the baked potatoes and the plate was smaller. Just…everything about it was not right. Quality was much lower. The drinks were fine but won’t come again. I had really good impressions but it’s all gone now.

Newly renovated rooftop place on top of Hyatt. A little bit on the pricy side. Seafood were surprisingly amazing. Cocktails are pretty decent but the seasonal drink menu was a bit bland I feel. Overall very good experience.

Writers room is a hidden gem in Toronto for sure. Really stunning views with great cocktails and ambience. This place is not cheap at all but I wouldn’t expect different from a sky bar in the Park Hyatt. Highly recommend the “A good day” and “Walking Dream” cocktails. Truly unique.  The food was decent too. The fried chicken and lamb tartare were awesome. I don’t recommend the tater tots.  Giving a 4* instead of 5 just because the food was really pricey for what it was but otherwise everything about this place was awesome!

editorial_summary.overview: Signature martinis served in a leather & suede setting on the 18th floor of the Park Hyatt Hotel.

278.name: Insomnia Restaurant and Lounge
278.formatted_address: 563 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6, Canada
reviews: I recently came to Insomnia for their weekday brunch and it was delicious!  The fruit was really fresh and the French toast+eggs Benedict were both delicious!  I usually come to this spot for late night eats and drinks and I was pleasantly surprised by their brunch aswell!  I will definitely be coming back and I would recommend this spot to a friend!

Amazing food, amazing vibes and amazing staff. Those 1lb mussels are ridiculously good almost criminal and i got a fried chicken burger and loved it. It had a bit of like maple syrup that really made it crazy good but not too much to drown the rest of the taste out. My girl got the chicken linguini and it was amazing. That and a bottle of wine made it a great night I’m definitely adding to my list of go to spots when I’m in the city.

When I checked this place out I really wanted to get some brunch  the food looked so good in the pictures. Unfortunately, I got there right before the start of the dinner menu. They had stopped serving brunch.  The space has a nice ambiance. The timing was such that we were the only people there but it didn't feel strange. You know that feeling when you're the only person at a restaurant and you start to wonder if you made the right decision? If there was a reason no one else is there? Well this wasn't the case. Felt right at home.  The food arrived relatively quick. Everything tasted absolutely incredible. The texture of the food was just right.  You get the feeling that this place has more of a nightclub feel at night. I still want to go back and have brunch here 🙂  I definitely recommend In-Somnia!

My friend and I had to wait for good 15 minutes for someone to come and take our order. Then good 45 minutes to get our food. Once we finished eating (in 20 minutes), we were asked to leave 15 minutes later because according to them, it had been a while. We would not have been sitting there for that long if the food was given to us sooner than 45 minutes. I will not be returning there again because of their slow service and time management skills. Food on the other hand was not bad. I ordered waffles and egg Benedict.

My date ordered Lorraine Benedict and I got citrus-spiked french toast. We had a wonderful experience! I must say, the setting is breathtaking. They have plants on the walls and fairy lights hanging from the ceiling, which I adore. They have the bathroom downstairs - it was modern and clean, which made me feel extra special.  My french toast was light, fluffy, and incredibly tasty. The presence of a hint of citrus flavour was unexpected, but it worked well. The experience blew me away; it was wonderful!  Our waiter was quite pleasant and helpful. As this is supposedly a popular brunch spot in downtown Toronto, it's quite busy. Otherwise, coming here was a pleasure!!

editorial_summary.overview: Spot known for brunch & late-night eats mixes global comfort food & 50 martinis, plus nightly DJs.

279.name: Proof Bar & Patio
279.formatted_address: 220 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1T8, Canada
reviews: I brought my wife here for her birthday and we had an amazing time. Thomas took care of us from start to finish and was amazing. The whole experience was fantastic and well executed. The dome/igloo was warm and cozy but not claustrophobic.  We got the package with a couple of appetizers and drinks and then ordered some food from the menu. Everything was delicious and presented nicely. We were also pleasantly surprised with the birthday dessert.  We had a great time here and recommend it to anyone.

We had the outdoor tent experience with a few friends Monday night.  First there were some confusions with our reservation as it was placed as a regular table.  It was originally placed as outdoor tent seating, but we had to change the time and it somehow it reverted to regular indoor seating (which we were just not interested in)  $65 per person will get you 1 drink, 1 appetizer and 1 dessert.   So don't expect to be full when you leave, unless you show up NOT hungry.  You can of course always order from the regular menu and add it in, which we had to do.  Add another drink per person, and you have yourself a bill north of $200 for 2 people, and no dinner was served.  Seating in the tent is casual, not a dinner sit down.   You are in essence "lounging" for 1.5hrs while picking at your apps.  The tents are nicely appointed, with enough seating for 6 comfortably.  There are orange blankets for added warmth, and the Halloween/ fall theme is nicely carried out throughout.  It was a nice experience.   Probably wouldn't do it again, but may visit again once they launch a Christmas themed experience.
A unique winter dining experience for any food lover.  The shelters provide a great setting for a quite evening, void of distractions allowing you to enjoy the company of one another.

Great hidden back patio that is very magical and whimsical with the patio lights and greenery. Nice servers that make it so enjoyable. Menu has a small selection of apps, mains and charcuterie. Lots of cheese and various prosciutto, nduja and hams. Wine selection is decent.  Would highly recommend it for an event or a small gathering with friends. It’s never been too busy but a great spot.

One of my favourite places in the city. Attentive, friendly service. Nice romantic vibes. Great food and drink. Cool patio area— there are heated igloo-type things in the colder months so you can still be outside (however, it is a fixed menu). Because it’s on Bloor and Avenue, it’s almost impossible to find parking so I’d suggest you use a ride share service, public transit, or walk.

editorial_summary.overview: White couches & a secluded patio in a hotel hangout that offers tapas & 50+ varieties of vodka.

280.name: Cat's Eye, Victoria College
280.formatted_address: 150 Charles St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1K6, Canada
reviews: The Cat's Eye is a beautiful, inclusive student-run space where anyone can come in to chill, game, study and just have a good time. It's a space for all students at Victoria College and U of T - and a second home for me.
The hostile Vic students glanced at me, a UC visitor in the staff room. I felt threatened, an outsider invited by a Vic STUDENT ;)
Great atmosphere, lots of bar games, quite often hosting open mike nights, kareoke and the like.
best place in UofT campus.

281.name: Exhibit Residences Exhibit Condominiums Presentation Lounge
281.formatted_address: 162 Cumberland St Suite 55, Toronto, ON M5R 3N5, Canada
reviews: Very nice condo

282.name: Parc Ave
282.formatted_address: 265 Davenport Rd 2nd floor, Toronto, ON M5R 1J9, Canada
reviews: The cocktails are amazing and Intricately thought out , service is excellent and the bartenders are extremely knowledgeable on the menu and even what’s not on the menu. Definitely try it out I have been back there a few times and enjoyed it every time
The best place to chill, hangout or to have a quality time. Superb decoration and service is beyond expectation. Probably you haven’t experience anything like it yet !!

Gorgeous space, delicious drinks. Ben, the bartender, made me the best mocktail taking into account my tastes. The hubby enjoyed his birthday treat! Towards 10:30/11:00 pm the volume and vibe really picked up as well with good looking crowds and a great DJ. We’re coming back!

Our group went for drinks last Wednesday (2022-12-28), and it was our first time at Parc Ave. Cocktail Bar.  We had a fantastic experience! The key element to our good time was our bartender (I believe her name is Margaretta, sorry if I got this wrong).   She took the time to understand what each of us looked for in a cocktail, and what kind of drink-mood we were in.  For myself I went with her suggestions, and she made me several freestyle cocktails that were honestly some of the most memorable drinks I've ever had.  The whole group was very happy with her guidance and enthusiasm. She knocked it out of the park, and we'll definitely be coming back!!  Thanks so much, Gord

Beautifully decorated, very tiny cocktail bar (almost a hotel bar vibe),   and large beautiful bar with focus on bottle service...Bit of a let down... Didn't match up to it's hype. Just opened so the hope is that it will get better.

283.name: d|bar
283.formatted_address: 60 Yorkville Ave, Toronto, ON M4W 0A4, Canada
reviews: our burger, our appetizers, our drinks were super amazing. we went there for our friend's birthday. she wanted to do a fancy dinner so I can tell you this is your place lol. their staff are super friendly and nice. the decor is also nice. totally recommend for a drink and snack.

I chose the D|Bar to celebrate my Birthday, and I am absolutely happy that I made this decision. I was pleased with food, service, and individual approach from every staff member.  Before writing this review I read few reviews about this bar, and some people wrote that the food was nothing special.  I will allow to disagree with these statements.  D|Bar & Four Seasons chef was able to take ingredients that we see everyday day and turn them into masterpieces. Very delicate flavors & absolutely astonishing presentations.  Great & relaxing atmosphere: I felt extremely good and couldn't stop smiling.  Thank you very much!

FOOD: nothing special but overpriced (I get it because it's in a hotel). But for the price I expected something more flavorful and just better. • Vietnamese salad: I'd say Vietnamese inspired salad, it's so bland and far from the original dish. • Oysters: fresh but really small • Tuna tartar: again, lack of flavor. I thought I had covid when I tried these dishes.  DRINKS: love the drinks I had • Afternoon tea: one of the most special drink I have ever tried, really creative. Smell and taste absolutely amazing, creamy and earl grey tea infused. • Collagen cocktail: very refreshing, they tried to make it special by light up a fresh passion fruit decorated on top of the cocktail.  INSIDE: quite crowed and loud after 10 11 ish. The vibe feels up scale but a little too dark.  SERVICE: very professional and fast, they have the service quality of a big hotel. We arrived and immediately got a valet parking

Amazing, personalized service.  We had High Tea ($65 per pax) as well as a burger from the lunch menu, plus a bottle of sparkling wine.  My hubby does not eat veggies and I noted this in the reservation. The restaurant took the effort to personalize his high tea items and replaced those that contained vegetables.  When he ordered an extra burger, the service staff knew immediately about his aversion to greens and asked if he would like them removed from the burger.  The small things that the staff took the effort to remember really made a big difference to the experience.  Food is good. Ambience is great. The defining aspect of the whole experience is the service.  All in all, we paid $300++ for everything. Expected from a luxury hotel.

Beautiful upscale bar for fancy folks looking to have a luxurious night night out. The cocktail prices start at a heinous $20 for maybe 150ml of drink. The drinks were scrumptious—however not for the price tag. The service was wonderful. Would recommend if you’re willing to spend a lot of money on small drinks.

editorial_summary.overview: Luxe hangout at the Four Seasons Toronto with craft cocktails, charcuterie & refined small plates.

284.name: Slanted Door
284.formatted_address: 442 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1X8, Canada
reviews: An okay cafe, mid sized, good seating selection. A good place if you just need to work or read a book. Chairs a not exactly too comfortable. I dog the art vibe here 8/10.  Place is blasting cold air and not in a " cold air on a hot day" kind of way. I had a brownie which was very good but coffee quality 4.6/10 and the baristas aren't too knowledgable on how to make anything. Overall 5.3/10 would not recommend. Find yourself another one around there's a bunch.

What a cool, relaxed, and calm shoppe!  Staff are incredibly friendly and kind. Terrific coffee and muffins, among other goodies and snacks. Love the local artists showcased throughout, and didn't expect such a spacious section downstairs. (Just wish there were allergen-free options...)

I was not super impressed with Slanted Door for breakfast. I hear their coffee is amazing, but the breakfast sandwich I had was not great (I did not understand the inclusion of pickles) and their hot chocolate was not chocolatey enough. The vegetarian options were available, but were not good. The art inside the shop is beautiful and the space is accessible including a washroom for people with physical disabilities.

OK this review is just on their energy balls. They were fantastic. Not too sweet lots of nuts and there was two versions when I was there a peanut butter and a chocolate peanut butter and the chocolate peanut butter was not overly sweet it was very nice. I did get a Americano and it was OK but I went back the next day as I was in the neighbourhood to get more energy balls. The café itself was full of people doing work at the tables. it’s pretty spacious but busy I would just go back for the energy bars. They have other things as well I think some breakfast sandwiches and croissants but I didn’t try those

Visited Slanted Door last week and it was such a relaxing and soft space to be in to focus and get work done. The baristas are seriously the sweetest people ever and care so much about customer experience. I will definitely return - the annex's true hidden gem!!

editorial_summary.overview: Typical coffee shop beverages, baked goods, & white brick walls covered in a series of rotating art.

285.name: Toronto Jazz Society
285.formatted_address: The Pauper’s Pub, 539 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6, Canada

286.name: Dream Escape - Cocktail and Bubble Tea Lounge
286.formatted_address: 570 Bloor Street West Lower Level, Toronto, ON M6G 1K1, Canada
reviews: Over all a fun experience! Lots of games to chose from, the staff was incredibly friendly. My server in particular gave everyone in my group a good laugh. I want to come back and try the escape rooms.  I found my drink to be "just okay". It was the pirate drink and where it had many flavours, it also had none? A very subtle sweetness. Not my thing, but I'm sure a lot of other people would like it.

Came here with my friends for the escape room and it was amazing. The game master also had wonderful energy, and hyped us all up.  They have a lot of board games and cool drinks as well. Looks like this will be our new hangout spot 😆 can’t wait to come back here again

We had our staff Christmas party at Dream Escape. The escape room was so fun. It is challenging but I loved the theme and all the sound effects. Lots of games to choose from and Mario Kart was a hit. Food was awesome. One colleague said they were the best chicken wings he'd ever had. And the drinks were so tasty. Everyone loved the signature cocktail and the mocktails. Oh and Karaoke was a bonus surprise hit! Thank you thank for hosting our group.

I never tried escape games before Dream Escape and my first experience won't be the last! Super cool, incredibly designed, and immersive game. My friends and I had a blast!  It's the type of place you know you will spend quality time. The staff is very friendly, I'll will definitely be returning for the new escape room.

I went with a group of 6 - we escaped from the alien themed escape room, then played games and had drinks. The escape room was a lot of fun - very thoughtfully put together, and challenging enough for the whole team to be involved and work together. There's also a great selection of games and lots of booth seating if you're looking for a place to hang out with a group of friends.  Also, I tried their non-alcoholic ginger beer, which was delicious!

287.name: Upper Brass
287.formatted_address: 699 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4Y 2B2, Canada

288.name: SU KARAOKE BAR
288.formatted_address: 649 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z9, Canada
reviews: My friends and I had a great time. Room was clean, sound system was good and so many options to chose from. Our room was ready on time and they even had a timer to let us know when our time was coming to an end. I would recommend booking for 3 hours if you are with a group. We went on a Friday and they were quite busy so we were unable to extend our time. Overall great experience

My friends and I had a lovely time here! The location is pretty great and the rooms are nice. Best part was that the rates are so cheap and affordable. Song selection for the most part was pretty good!  Totally recommend :)
The prices are great, wide soju selection, and huge song book to choose from. The staff is very nice and the rooms are very clean. Overall a very good experience I can't wait to go back again.

So this place was very nice, I really liked the bar vibe at the bar. You should know that unlike other karaoke places you cannot bring outside food to the private rooms. Also there isn't service to your private room, you have to go to the bar....which is totally fine. It was very clean...also clean washrooms. Some thing to be aware of that I saw other ppl mention and was a bit unsure. I read reviews where ppl say that it's hard to manage the karaoke book or list as it's in Korean....it's actually not difficult once you actually give it a try. The songbook/tablet is in Korean but has buttons in English....and that's all you really need to know, how to punch in artist, how to punch in a song and how to delete a song. Overall we all had a good time. The only thing that I thought was very weird and silly was that we were there for a birthday and the birthday person left a gift which was 2 chocolate bars and a card in the room. The room was cleared out immediately after the group got out. In under the hour someone went back to say "hey, did you find a card and two chocolates left behind? They were a gift"...... The response from the staff was all shoulder shrugged and "ummm we throw everything out.... But your card is here" We admit the items should not have left behind but don't u put things aside or were they eaten asap? 🤣 Very silly.

Came with a bunch of coworkers for someone's birthday. It was our first time coming to this karaoke bar.  A majority of the songs are in Korean even the set up but they do have large book with songs that you can pick from.  However the English songs only have a small selection so you'll be more likely to find the more popular songs from the 90s/2000s.

289.name: House Of Lancaster Two
289.formatted_address: 1215 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1N4, Canada
reviews: The one on the queensway was my favourite before it closed. The male strippers were amazing. I hope this location has the same. Both a female and male side? Either way looking forward to visit!!!

I highly recommend coming here i just wanted to say I had the time of my life 2 weeks ago getting up on stage and in the shower with mizz Lancaster and the beautiful dancer I got my dances from couldn't remember her name I will definitely be back and bringing some of my buddy's with me

went there last night after apparently having a fake ID which isn't fake as I had a fully grown facial hair at another club down the street as I walked in it was the usual cover fee of $5 dollars after 7pm but the main area was smaller  than the club I went to drinks are reasonable prices and the girl know how to work the pole and dance and trust me when I say this it's a lot different from the other stripclub u go to and the girls are fine not all but most are
Terrible place never go here! Scam you on visa and debit charges and atm be aware! Bad place terrible experience.

Went there after long time to meet up with frinds such a garbage place $10 for entery then u see all old stripers then when  u take a striper for dance the guy sitting upstairs charge u another $20 for the room what kinda nonsence is that. its waist of time going there never again. 👎👎👎

290.name: The Piston
290.formatted_address: 937 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1L4, Canada
reviews: Super friendly crowd, they were a little older, although it was expected since I was there for a New Years Eve 80s party. The staff is extremely cool and friendly, amazing service!

A lot of white af music was put on when we were expecting good 90's songs to be played at this '90s Video Music Dance Party', also hip hop was literally the biggest genre in the 90s, yet they only played a select few hip hop tracks🥱. They also had us stand in line for over 45min despite all the people leaving the bar/dance floor. Vibe of the bar was nice enough but then they charged me $6 for a basic $1.50 ginger beer bottle after I asked for a non alcoholic beverage🙃😒. The owner needs to hire DJ's that plays a more diverse mix and to be professional when replying to the (multiple) criticisms from reviews. Read some of the other reviews too and he replies in the exact same manner.🙄
Truly a hidden gem of a venue. Great sounding room, super friendly staff and everyone always loves playing there. My company Agoria Productions hosts shows here on the regular. Definitely recommend!
90s dj set sent us back to school time) nostalgic and fun music and atmosphere. It's been packed, better to come earlier before 10pm to avoid lineups. Affordable prices for cocktails and drinks!

Went to the PISSton’s so-called 90’s party. They only played hip hop and grunge music on YouTube over a projector screen. No dance music or other variety. A waste and the most boring party ever. And there weren’t any basic bar food like nachos. Yawn.

editorial_summary.overview: A main bar with cozy booths & a hopping back room for live acts, plus tapas & gourmet sandwiches.

291.name: Club Paradise
291.formatted_address: 1313 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1P1, Canada
reviews: Do not pay a dancer up front. A dancer charged me 200 dollars and said it was for 30 minutes. After 10 minutes, she said it was over. She said I lost track of time. She got up and left the booth. I spoke to the manager and he said she would be fired. There was a scam but the management took it seriously, thus I gave a 2 star rating, not 1.
Management is half a sleep, some of the girls dont bother, the rooms dont have enough leg room for the dancers, why does this place exist?

Go to Lancaster. This place is grungy, dirty, the girls aren’t attractive or nice and the management and ownership don’t know how to run it. They’re are rude and racist. One of the managers himself (the penguin from 1960’s Batman looking one) stated that rap music is “monkey” music and doesn’t want it playing at the club. Spend your money and your time somewhere else. This place can rot.

They play music that u can vibe with, drinks are affordable and the girls are friendly, beautiful and  down to earth just know ur place and don't do too much and the security and manager are always making sure that ur having a blessed night

Its a small place dirty looking but the waitresses are friendly and hot. The strippers are all beautiful. One Romanian chic goes by name Daniela is the hottest one there. Very friendly and fun and well worth taking for dances, you wont be disappointed well worth the money

292.name: FOXXES DEN MALE REVUE
292.formatted_address: 1215 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1N4, Canada
reviews: Bartender Anthony is a huge reason why I go to this club over others. He is the perfect balance of extremely attentive but not pushy. Drinks are made well and quickly.  Dancers are hot and the music is always great. Really fun atmosphere. I literally go to this club alone sometimes and I always have an amazing time, never a dull moment!
i had the most hottest dancer ever! His name is harold. If you go here i recommend getting Harold. He  gave me a really good lap dance! ❤️

Absolutely disgusted and disappointed in this club. Decent cover charge however, 9.50 for a bottle of water is ridiculous. The dancers (if you want to call them that) seemed nice until they wanted to take you into the back room. Not once do they mention how they charge for vip dances. After basically being forced and dragged into the back room, feeling completely violated and having the dancer force himself on me, came back to my seat to be told I owe him $100. He was persistent on waiting right at my side while I paid him. Ladies beware….they charge $20 a song and do not give you the choice to have them stop or continue dancing. I’ve been going to another club (klub kave) for months now and have never ever felt so violated and upset being there as I did at this place. The dancers didn’t barely do anything and for the most part, I felt like I was at a ballerina recital. I will not be attending this venue ever again. I literally left almost in tears and severe anger. The best part about the venue was Mario, the bartender.

Went on a Saturday night and it was so trash. They had females Downstairs that did not know what they were doing. The bartenders down there were extremely rude and arrogant. We bought the same amount of drinks down there that we did upstairs and they charged a lot more. The men upstairs I wouldn't even call real strippers.
Best place I’ve ever been, the guys are incredible and really kind, the bar staff is phenomenal and attentive, 10/10 would recommend

293.name: Jive Nation Toronto
293.formatted_address: 1573 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1A6, Canada

reviews: Us a Gay Couple  we feel verry welcomed by the club
Great place for parties
Big club, great  people and nice atmosphere.
Nice space and cold beer, good visit.
Madeira Island well represented! Keep up the great work!

295.name: LA BAMBA Lounge
295.formatted_address: 1355 St Clair Ave W, Toronto, ON M6E 1C5, Canada
reviews: This club is like being in a Mexican or Latin-American club. The music is great, the staff is very welcome. Overall a great and fun place to face Latin music

Ok this spot is so sketchy lol and hot as a   sauna no fans no ac NADA!!! The dance floor dances as well,  u feel like u gonna fall through the floor and security only checks ur ID it was a bit wild and fun at the same time but a place I most likely won't go back to but if u like that kinda stuff this is the spot for u. Oh yeah music was on fire 🔥 🔥🔥🔥
They have Latin Dancing on Wednesdays nights. I like the ambiance and decor. Drinks are $5. Great way to relax and take the stress away midweek!
Amazing place, had an amazing time ,sweet Latino vibe will make you dance all night. Amazing crew as well.
Amazing music , big place , good service excellent security PEOPLE GO AND ENJOY DANCING , FEELING TO BE FREE AND HAPPY

296.name: Epic Lounge
296.formatted_address: 1355 St Clair Ave W, Toronto, ON M6E 1C5, Canada
reviews: Its nice place to hang with friends do Birthday party, Bachelor out free parking outside TD bank also on the side street  Doing new things all the time
You can dance kizomba here every other friday "FLAVOR FRIDAYS" very sexy and sensual yet safe and friendly ...RESPECTFUL!
Had my work x-mas dinner here; the food was fantastic and the place is a really classy lounge on Corso Italia.
#ripofff they don't respect alcool hours, they shut the bar too early and lying that it's open up to 2AM
Good music, nice people and cheap drinks!! 😁 😁

297.name: Glamour Sports Bar
297.formatted_address: 1474 St Clair Ave W, Toronto, ON M6E 4P5, Canada
reviews: Went there to watch copa final, ordered a beer , never served, jammed, I get it it’s the final game but they could do better to serve us since we were clients
Very basic sports bar. Cash only and literally just a bat and two tables.  Bottles of imported cost $6 and domestic $5.  Brazilian waitress was very accommodating and kind.
Good music. Nice bartenders and server. Pricey. Snotty patrons as well. Not a friendly one in the place the 5 times I've been there. Unless you're one of them.
It was an amazing night great time
Great place to have a beer, beefana and hang out with your friends on the patio.

298.name: Toronto Style Bar & Grill
298.formatted_address: 1546 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1A4, Canada
reviews: One THE BEST pub grubs I've had. The owners are very kind and considerate. You can just tell the food was made with love, best hot wings I've had in Toronto.

Nice atmosphere! Great bartenders, cheap drinks. Great menu but so far only had the medium wings but so damn good! Go Toronto Go ! UPDATE: 14/08/2022 Had the basmati rice and a side of 12 wings and Toronto Style Sauce and it was all great, see photo.

... this brilliant and unique bar embodies the 90's era Toronto Raptors purple and red aesthetic while honoring its own unique spin on bar cuisine. With a mesh of Indian and Canadian dishes, Toronto Style Bar & Grill is a trip.  Rainbow lights. Karaoke on weekends. Pool and darts available.  THE SWEETEST WAITRESS EVER.  ... I will be returning very soon.  Located near Keele Station, after getting lost in High Park, this experience was a beautiful surprise at the end of an amazing day.  Cheers. ❤️ 💜 🍺 🍻 🍺 💜 ❤️

Passed on this bar for years for its kitch-y exterior, and it was honestly a truly regrettable decision... And i do not live my life with much regret.  This bar is amazing. Small but mighty. Great service from friendly staff. It feels like home, with friendly patrons and inclusive activities.  The drinks and food are well priced, and this place is worth a visit if you enjoy a real bar free of edison bulbs, industrial style stools, neon signs that would say "Dont let me eat alone" or something like that. This is an honest and humble bar and you'll feel the warmth immediately!
Toronto Style hosted my friend's Halloween event and they were wonderful! The Halloween decor they put up was also great!!

299.name: DjBradleyCalvo
299.formatted_address: 2869 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9, Canada

300.name: Rod, Gun & Barbers
300.formatted_address: 2877 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9, Canada
reviews: Beyond barber shop 💈 bar on weekend nights with live music. My to go barber is Trek. Decent price, easy booking system.

I'm brand new to the neighbourhood and was in desperate need of a cut (it had been six months since my last cut) so I booked an appointment with Sean.  I told him to have at it and see what he does with it and I have to say he was not only incredibly knowledgeable about his craft, but he was very careful to explain why he was doing specific things.  Well worth the money I spent. Affordable, amazing tunes to listen to (we were singing some Motown together the entire time), and just an overall great vibe in the atmosphere.  For friendly service and a guaranteed great end result, check this place out!!

Awesome vibe, awesome people!  I Was in town for a wedding and the men in the bridal party were booked for cuts, we were INCREDIBLY behind and showed up super late but these amazing people got us in chairs despite that. The conversation was great with my barber (Sean I think) and the cut was fantastic. If I'm ever in Toronto again in need of a snip, these guys are where my money is going!

This is my go to barber in the city. Lots of stylist available and you can't beat the decor.I found this place about two years ago, and haven't gone anywhere else to get a haircut since. You can have drink there while having your hair cut. Trek  has been cutting and styling my  hair and beard  for the past the last 2  years and I don't think I would go anywhere else.The Price is not cheap but  reasonable for all the amazing service that they provided. Highly recommend this shop.
Great barber shop! Good, experienced staff. The inside is very cool, they also have a bar! Cheers

301.name: Bachata
301.formatted_address: 805 Dovercourt Rd, Toronto, ON M6H 2X4, Canada

302.name: New York New York Karaoke
302.formatted_address: 985 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1M1, Canada
reviews: Super sketchy. They make you buzz to get inside. Once inside its 80$ for 1 hr. And the device to use the Karaoke is in an Oriental language. So sucks if you don't understand.

Went in and found out it’s $60 for a small room and $120 for a large per hour but this price includes drinks up to a certain point. There are much cheaper places, this is only worth it if you are gonna be drinking a lot. Looked clean and nice tho
Nice Karaoke bar in hidden location. Wii karaoke is far better than DAM karaoke. I love this place.
Good place to meet hookups
Dirty very very dirty

303.name: Anniversary Park
303.formatted_address: 410 Parliament St, Toronto, ON M5A 2Z7, Canada
reviews: Very small parkette.  Not much space to sit down and relax.  Usually relatively crowded. Not necessarily a place I would suggest sitting down to relax as a female (if your by yourself especially).  There are usually some very questionable characters in the park and it's common to be have men harrass you if you're even just walking by.
Adorable little park and usually quite clean. A sweet spot to bring a book and watch the world move by.
Went by this fake park a few weeks ago and there were a bunch of guys yelling random things definitely wouldn't recommend
Calling this a parkette, I feel would be a better fit for this. It's a traffic island where Parliament St & Dundas St E meet. There is a transit stop here for the Streetcar & bus.
I would consider if one of the ugliest parks in the city

304.name: Percy Park
304.formatted_address: 12 Percy St, Toronto, ON M5A 3M8, Canada
reviews: A lovely little green oasis which was an unexpected find. So green and well-maintained. I loved the roses!
Percy Park is a small little area.  It's got some shade and a few places to sit.  Not much else there.
Small hidden rest stop amidst the chaos around it...peaceful.
It was secluded and a nice area to just relax and enoy the moment
Little qabla, sweet place to be at.

305.name: Trinity Square Labyrinth
305.formatted_address: 24 Trinity Square, Toronto, ON M5G 1B1, Canada
reviews: Who knew there was a labyrinth right in the middle of downtown Toronto. While walking the area I noticed a sign directing you to the labyrinth and decided to go check it out. It is a large circle in Trinity Square with a path leading to the centre using paving stones of two tones. It was just an interesting way to spent a few quiet minutes tracing the route to the centre of the labyrinth. The square was also being used by a few homeless with tents set up but although I thought they probably question the logic of wandering a route through the Labyrinth, they just ignored us.

Not much to look at but there is shade and a grassy area to sit and eat lunch. The labyrinth wasn't all too impressive i.m.h.o, just flat concrete and map of the area to walk. Tried to get a better vantage point with the drone but got the dreaded "too close to an airport" warning. Nice place to relax for a bit but not much else. Some areas near the church have a few aggressive homeless people there so just be on your toes...

Very pleasant, spacious, cool oasis in the middle of downtown hustle and bustle. Centred between the Eaton Centre, Old City Hall, and containing one of the city's oldest churches, this is a perfect escape.

The Toronto Public Labyrinth (formerly the Trinity Square Park Labyrinth) is Toronto's first outdoor labyrinth in a public park. Designed by Stuart and Mary Bartholomaus from Knoxville, Tennessee. The labyrinth was created out of turf grass, temporarily, but is now constructed out of paving stone. The labyrinth is 77 feet in diameter. It is a copy of the 13th century stone labyrinth at Chartres Cathedral in France.  Installation of the Toronto Public Labyrinth The Labyrinth was installed as a Millennium project in partnership between Parks, Forestry and Recreation and the Toronto Labyrinth Community Network (TLCN). TLCN is a grassroots community organization which fosters the creation of labyrinths as meditation tools in the Greater Toronto Area. In partnership with Toronto Parks and Recreation and the nearby Church of the Holy Trinity, the group guided the creation of the Trinity Square Park Labyrinth as a Millennium Year project.  TLCN, in continued collaboration with Parks and Recreation, will also guide the development of the "Lasting Labyrinth", a permanent labyrinth feature of stone and grass, to be installed at Trinity Square Park.
There is nothing special about this place it's a good place to sit and eat your food or walk around , but it's relatively a small area located behind the CF Eaton Center next to giant trash bin!

306.name: Regent Park
306.formatted_address: 620 Dundas St E, Toronto, ON M5A 3S4, Canada
reviews: Great Park for kids and teens and Large Feild for anything, Dog Park!. A great park for all

I like coming here sitting on the benches, chilling out on the lawn under the shade of a tree, and watching the dogs go by.  I would recommend checking the ground before you lay down your blanket for doggie presents. If you see a BFG there smoking a cigar wave and say Hi! ;)
Nice park and play area for kids. Adults can have their own time, can read a book on park benches. There's splash pad for summer.  love this place
Just went here the other day, and I must say that there are lots of restaurants nearby! Definitely recommended if your wanting to have a casual date with friends..

I love my neighborhood but unfortunately the people that live here make it not enjoyable sometimes. They should put a better dog park here so that their aren't dogs running around off leash everywhere. When I walk my dog on leash there are others who let their dogs roam off leash and it makes it uncomfortable for me.

307.name: Allan Gardens
307.formatted_address: 160 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M5A 2E5, Canada
reviews: Was really nice, quite warm (it's a green house so makes sense). Didn't cost a thing, was totally FREE! The gardens have three halls. The walking path is not always wide and accessible ♿, and there is only one bench to sit on (in the farthest garden). The vegetation in the garden is diverse and presented in a nice way. There are also turtles! Really loved it 💕

Wow! Such a beautiful greenhouse! Just as good as others that I have had to pay $15 to enter...this one's free!! It's very big with many different sections that have all sorts of beautiful plants + Koi Fish and turtles!! The main building is super pretty and they're doing renovations right now to make it even better.

I came here on the final day of my plant biology course, and it was an amazing time. There were so many cool looking plants, and flowers, including some that I didn't even think I'd see in Canada (like the papaya or the Dutchman's pipe). This is a great place to go to, to see all kinds of spectacular floral displays you might not be able to see anywhere else - and the best part is that it's free!

The gardens are beautiful and it's plenty warm inside. Is it worth taking a trip specifically for it? You'll be done walking around in 30 minutes at most, especially now after they closed the palm house for renovations. Still, if you happen to be in the area or live in downtown, it's worth making a stop. It's free and the gardener was very friendly to answer inquiries.

no matter what season outside, it's always summer here. I just love this place. so happy to see it reopened after a very long Covid -19 closure. there are some renovations under way now, so part of the greenhouse is not available (sadly including the washrooms). it is free and opened 7 days a week. a few benches inside which is wonderful. it tends to be super busy on the weekends so try to visit during the week if you can. Keep in mind that it is not the most savoury part of the city and you might encounter some interesting characters around the greenhouse, but they usually mind their own business. if you miss connection with fauna, you can connect with turtles, fish and an occasional squirrel. the place is really well maintained, there are always beautiful flowers. Lovely cacti in the north part.

editorial_summary.overview: A collection of plants from around the world housed in a cast-iron & glass building dating to 1910.

308.name: Underpass Park
308.formatted_address: 29 Lower River Street, Toronto, ON M5A 1M6, Canada
reviews: 2022 July 3.5★ A nice park / playground underneath the Gardiner highway. It's nice as it revitalizes the area, provides shade and some rain coverage. The few playground structures include a climbing hexagon, rope climbing apparatus along related rope items.  The wall murals / paintings are pretty nice and certainly livens up the atmosphere.
The Underground Park is a great public space for all. Covered by stunningly colourful art murals by local artists, this space hosts daily skateboarding enthusiasts, and farmers markets on Thursdays.

Wow, can't say enough good things about this place. We need more spots like this as an outlet for our kids and teens. Saw some women leading some children through stretching and yoga moves all while trying to keep out of the rain. Bad weather can't stop all these people from getting fresh air and exercise. Just up the street the is also a very lively skate park filled with kids having fun. There is also a workout area and a jungle gym set up too. Big props to the city of Toronto for having this place, more provinces need to adopt this type of thinking. We do have skate/bike parks in Victoria B.C but this place is on another level with murals and the overpass above makes it very unique..

It is unbelievable this place is just beautiful for kids kids art and culture sure I'm mixed in this list Basketball skateboarding bicycle jumping hoops whatever you want to do is the spot .hidden right underneath everyday commute..

Neat treatments of murals on each concrete pylon supporting the roadway above. It turns an urban blight into welcoming public space with a skateboard park and a more traditional kids playground. With access to the Don River and surrounded by posh condos.

editorial_summary.overview: Play area under a road bridge with a basketball court, playground, skate ramps & colorful graffiti.

309.name: Sugar Beach Park
309.formatted_address: 11 Dockside Dr, Toronto, ON M5A 1B6, Canada
reviews: A perfect spot to spend time with your loved ones. Pink shades with white chairs and sand create a mesmerizing ambience. Quite happening during weekends daytime. The best thing is that it's really clean and pets are not allowed unleashed. Kids love playing with sand here.

Sugar Beach is a park that is walking distance to the city centre but is far enough that you don’t hear much of the traffic noises. There are beach chairs to sit on under iconic pink beach umbrellas. The sand isn’t the best as people do throw out trash and cigarette butts, but it’s nice enough to be able to take your shoes off and feel the warm sand between your toes. It is not too busy on weekdays with most people just lounging around relaxing or trying to get a sun tan. It’s a great place to relax and escape from the busyness of the city.

This is a nice little park to walk through on the water front. I felt very safe here as a single female. I found it was mostly just locals on their walks with their dogs when I visited midday. The biggest downside to this park is there isnt much to do. There is not a lot of green space to play on and there are a few benches, but I found they were usually taken. Its definitely worth a visit, but I would plan to walk end to end in 15 minutes and then head towards the beach or the harbor
A small yet beautiful place on the lake front. Sun umbrellas and several chairs are placed around for Comfortable sitting & relaxing. Very popular.

Was a nice place to go for a walk especially in the winter. The sunset was a bright red, the winter sun gleamed in the horizon. The kids had a lot of fun breaking ice pieces off the ground and throwing it onto the lake. The breeze was immense, it was a peaceful escape in the city. Would recommend to anyone looking for a winter stroll in the city. Only criticism is the ugly slush and dirty snow that is not cleaned.

editorial_summary.overview: Urban, 2-acre, harbourfront park with beach chairs, umbrellas, a kid's splash pad & rock formations.

310.name: Lawren Harris Square
reviews: One of the worst planned intersection in Toronto. It’s basically a reversed roundabout (traffic flows clockwise here) with stop signs and lights that are not consistent. I keep seeing cars and bikes travel instinctively how ordinary roundabouts flow, however in this case they are going the wrong way on a one way! Change this intersection with an ordinary roundabout!

Last year the trees were dieing from lack of water underground system not working. I spoke to city parks about it but nothing was done . This year I find out nothing has been fixed so when it get warm, hot weather the trees will die They have not grown a inch since they been planted . Gravel and lack of water what a waste of money no brainer
It's the plot of gravel I walk through on my way to the park.  They stuck some small trees and giant pots with plants.  I haven't seen anyone use it for much else.
It's a gravel park with some trees and plant pots. Nothing special yet. Since it's named after Lawren Harris, it ought to have a theme related to his artwork.

I find this a pathetic excuse of a park. The trees and benches are nice, but the fact that fine gravel was used instead of something green on the bottom surface just ruins it. Maybe it's just disappointing relative to Corktown Common.

311.name: York Quay
311.formatted_address: 145 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2H4, Canada
reviews: Crowded waterfront park very cool it is by  the bay
We had time, it was very hot, we took the opportunity to walk near the lake and finally, we took a one-hour cruise to admire the beauty seen from the lake.

312.name: Wellesley Park
312.formatted_address: 500 Wellesley St E, Toronto, ON M4X 1H9, Canada
reviews: Greenery is soo good for summer. This place is quite and has a good treat to walk. They have benches here to chill around along with nice huge trees.  There is also a green space and stair case to trek down and above. It’s pretty quite and cool here.  There is a dustbin and and recycle bin for maintaining the cleanliness.  Make sure you don’t get here when it’s raining as it might get very mushy and sticky.  Good place for a small family picnic and enjoyment.
Good park for kids to play. It has  water splash and play area
Quiet cute little sand park with water park. Accessible swings and entrance

Beautiful small park anytime of the year. We take our evening walks though here every evening and love the fall views as the trees turn color each year. Always very quiet and relaxing anytime of the day or week.
Park has a badminton court but no net.. also has a children's play area as well as water fountain. Good place to laze around. Has multiple parks in the surrounding.

313.name: Regent Park Learning Centre
313.formatted_address: 417 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M5A 2H4, Canada
reviews: Great park
Love

314.name: Corktown Common
314.formatted_address: 155 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M5A 0G4, Canada
reviews: 2022 July 3★ A good amount of green space, a small play area with a slide, swings and a see saw. A splash pad nearby. Most people come here to just relax, picnic and really enjoy the weather. The trails are nice and are part of a larger path.  Pros: public washrooms Limited Paid parking on nearby side streets.

Ummm. There’s something about this park I can’t quite point, maybe it’s the layout or the architecture, you walk in the ways and end up in the same place that’s common to all. 4 stars because I saw a frog, a baby bunny and some water lilies in the swamp pond. Otherwise I’d give it a 3 maybe? I don’t know if it were just my expectations. I do like the area and the place it’s located in. Other parks are more open and vast spaces without barriers, this one has multiple small hangout places with barriers.

The pros to this park is that it has lots of green space to have a picnic or to relax. There are benches and picnic tables available. There is a nice small swirl of a trail as well. The splash pad is decent but what sells is the view. You can see the CN tower and the city from the splash pad. My 3 year old had an absolutely amazing time! The park is pretty nice too with swings, slides and see-saws. It is close to distillery district by walk.  The cons is definitely the parking. The outdoor street parking AND indoor parking fill up so fast!! We spent over 15-20 minutes looking for parking. I’m not a fan of the metal slides in the playground. We went on a hot July afternoon and I had to say no to my son who wanted to go on the slide so badly.

The landscape design is thoughtful and calming. There’s something for everyone: kids playground, dog owners, solo walkers, couples, and groups. The mini park connects to the DVP trial and lakeshore trail east and west making it easy for bikers and runners. I only wish it were 10 times bigger. Public washrooms available.

Wow! Didn't expected this thoughtfully designed green space and recreational area. It seems like an ideal environment for local residents to relax and play here. With all the condos in the new Canary District, it probably is still not enough green space for the growing population... Yesterday, there were so many people in the park area - all the picnic tables were occupied. But for what it's worth, it is still a gem.

editorial_summary.overview: Large park featuring playgrounds, a splash pad & walking paths, plus picnic tables & washrooms.

315.name: Cloud Gardens
315.formatted_address: 14 Temperance St, Toronto, ON M5H 1Y4, Canada
reviews: Update on December 2018: Due to construction at an adjacent site, the park is now closed. Expected to open in the fall of 2022. See image of construction notice uploaded.  A green oasis right in the middle of the financial district.  It has nooks and crannies throughout, so be careful when you visit. I found drug needles and discarded clothing and garbage on the upper levels. The park isn't well maintained, which is such a shame. I didn't feel comfortable visiting this park - not even on an early Sunday morning - because of people loitering there.
Great place for a little break from the city. Small greenhouse, but very calming. Interesting array of plants. Worth the trip here if you’re in the area!
Actually really liked this spot! It’s in the heart of downtown, so it’s a nice dose of greenery. Nothing too notable in terms of plants, but it’s a quiet and small place to unwind and relax.
If they had someone clean up the garbage more often this park a great 5-star spot. Great looking park no play ground but fun for adults.
Urban oasis. The waterfalls and the greenhouse are refreshing. The juxtaposition between nature and the city is really nice.

316.name: Berczy Park
316.formatted_address: 35 Wellington St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1C6, Canada
reviews: Peaceful and beautiful  little park right in the heart of the downtown. The large fountain in the middle with the dog statues that spray the water is a pretty nifty piece of architecture. Plenty of grassy spots, tables and chairs setup. Perfect for a picnic, coffee break, or to just relax and chat. The tranquil esque music that can be heard playing a long with the sounds of the water in the fountain only adds to the relaxing atmosphere. Also, see if you can find the cat and bird statues!

Small but beautiful park with a unique fountain. Located close to the flat iron building (Gooderham) and St Lawrence Market. Plenty of benches and some green space to sit at. It was relatively busy during lunch time with dog walkers and people of all ages passing through the park.
Cute Small park with lots of benches and chairs around tables. Landscaping and gardening is nice. Everything is clean and well maintained. Plus there's a huge dog water fountain in the middle 🤣

Great park with lots of sitting opportunities and many squirrels around. I visited during fall, so I had nice views on the colored foliage. Despite being in the middle of the city and close to St. Lawrence, it's very easy to forget the noise. You can grab coffee or food nearby and enjoy the sun or just take a break from shopping.

A gorgeous little park in a busy area. There is a gorgeous dog fountain in the centre with many well-maintained flowers nearby and multiple benches. Great place to take your dog for a walk or just sit and enjoy the day.

editorial_summary.overview: Tree-lined park featuring an open plaza with a 2-tiered fountain with dog & cat sculptures.

317.name: David Crombie Park
317.formatted_address: 131 The Esplanade, Toronto, ON M5A 4P5, Canada
reviews: Beautiful park in downtown Toronto in esplanade area. Kinds friendly. Clean. Beautiful flowers. Few basketball courts.
It’s a really long park along esplanades it includes dog 🐕 park, wading pool and playground 🛝

As the sign says it's a "city within a park". Has a little bit of everything: a place for kids to play on swings, a basketball court, places to sit, street art, and two cute examples of trees that are "yarn bombed". Dogs are allowed. But pay attention to the signs, because they can only be in certain areas.
Very long park with something new on every block.  Art, basketball hoops, jungle gyms, dog areas, wading pools...this irregular shaped park has what you need for a fun day out.
The west end of the park closer to the Market is the best if you have small kids. And in the summer the wading pool is amazing.

editorial_summary.overview: Public park with a basketball court, wading pool, off-leash dog area & playground equipment.

318.name: St. James Park
318.formatted_address: 120 King St E, Toronto, ON M5C 1G6, Canada
reviews: Wonderful park for kids and adults. It has got so many trees so summers are always cool. Even its great with the autumn leaves and St. James cathedral in the vicinity. Lovely spot for photography.

was it clean: yes was it efficient: n/a was it kind: n/a was it straightforward: n/a most importantly WAS IT ZEN? Yes! A lovely spot to enjoy sunshine and green space midst the bustle of the city. Compact playground and plenty benches to people watch and enjoy the St. James Cathedral bells ring!
Fascinating view and greenery throughout the park. Spacious enough and have a clean walkway. Maintained space for kids to play and adults to just hangout catching sunset or sunrise moment.

Our favorite park in the city! Right next to the St James Cathedral. Just recently renovated, it has beautiful gardens with a small fountain and also one of the best playgrounds.  Though it’s located in downtown it feels calm and relaxing here. Love this place!
Lovely park beside the cathedral at King and Church. A little piece of green space around concrete blocks. Great to relax at the menu benches. There's a kids playground, stage, and flower garden.

editorial_summary.overview: Scenic city park featuring flower gardens, walking paths, a fountain & a produce-themed playground.

319.name: Sherbourne Common
319.formatted_address: 61 Dockside Dr, Toronto, ON M5A 1B6, Canada
reviews: Really nicely built common area with multi-purposes! The Sherbourne Common South houses a lot of tons of green area for picnics with the south side of the park offering a year-round activity as a splash pad or skating rink pending on the season. It also has a water treatment facility at the pavilion as well and releases it from the three art sculptures located on the north side of the park. Pretty iconic structures!  The north side also houses a lot of the playground type facilities like see-saws but also houses the three art sculptures that release out the treated storm water and lake water. The sculptures entitled "Light Showers" are a sight to see at night as they light up at night and motion sensors trigger light patterns!

We stumbled upon this park during our hike along the Waterfront. The City of Toronto is always doing Reconstruction of the Waterfront.  The Sherbourne Common is a combination of art and water-treatment facility.

This place expensive condominiums are being built and some of them are almost done.The prizes range from 2 million Canadian dollars and it seems some units were already occupied. The builder is Tridel corporation who looks like a reputable company. It is located in downtown Toronto along Queens Quay and Sherbourne.
My favourite place downtown. So serene and beautiful!
Love to visit the Sherbourne common, great view of the lake, calming, at the moment water treatment construction is going on here. May 10, 2022

editorial_summary.overview: Waterfront oasis with a seasonal skating rink & splash pad, a contemporary fountain & harbor views.

320.name: Fountain at Nathan Phillips Square
320.formatted_address: The PATH - City Hall, Toronto, ON M5H 2N2, Canada
reviews: Iconic landscape and great must-visit tourist spot to get photos of Toronto. It's also a good meeting spot with friends and family. There's always something interesting and events hosted here at Nathan Phillips Square.  Located at Nathan Phillips Square (in front of City Hall), this versatile large water fountain remains as a fountain/pond during Spring, Summer and Fall. While in Winter, the fountain transforms into an outdoor Ice Rink for the public to enjoy. There are skates rentals on site but be prepared to line up and bring ID. This captivating setting is enjoyed all year long for people of all ages. Many seasonal activities and events are planned around this fountain and at Nathan Phillips Square so be sure to check the Festivals & Events Page on the City of Toronto's website.  Also to note, from the southwest corner of the fountain, you can take a photo of the iconic Toronto 3D Sign with the Toronto City Hall in the background. The fountain's arches are called "The Freedom Arches" that span over the pool/skating rink. At the base of the arches is a piece of the Berlin Wall. Conveniently accessible via Eaton Center along Bay Street (closest TTC Subway station would be Queen Station).
Very nice area with the iconic Toronto sign overlooking it.  Arches and spouts for this 10in or so deep fountain.  Oh .. please don't climb the arches and don't fall in!  Lol
Not great for skating. Gets too busy during evenings for it to be enjoyable, especially if you are a new skater. Also wouldn't recommend renting skates here, as the line tends to be very long.

Beautiful square in downtown Toronto! Perfect for some photo op with family. From there you are in the center of old Toronto and can easily access some of the nicest spot in the city. I also recommend to head to Eaton Center from there for some nice A/C air during hot summer in Canada. The green path surrounding the square is really nice to visit and gives visitors some green space in the middle of the great city.
Best place to visit with friends and family great hangout area . Restroom are worst be careful.  Skating during winter will be fun.

321.name: Outdoor Basketball Court
321.formatted_address: Moss Park, Toronto, ON M5A 2R6, Canada

322.name: Moss Park
322.formatted_address: 150 Sherbourne St, Toronto, ON M5A 1S4, Canada
reviews: Moss park is located in what can be described as Toronto’s skid row. It is neighbourhood park with lots of amenities for locals. And a bit rundown. Having said that it is a great park with an ice rink softball diamond tennis courts community centre with a great outdoor fenced kids area, community garden and bike share terminal. It also is hang out area for the homeless consequently all of the park benches are gone to discourage “overnight guests “. The neighbourhood is up and coming with many new condo developments near by. On its west end is an Armoury. In the years ahead the city is planning a complete makeover of the park which will also include its own subway station. Come back in 10 years to see the new park and gentrified neighbourhood. For now visit in the day and get great photos of the downtown towers especially just before sunset.

This is my 6th year at Moss Park Community garden. The people are very friendly. If your a true gardener and your not expecting to feed your family from your harvest you'll do great. It is Moss Park after all. More pics to come...

Not a safe place to hangout with kids. A lot of people with drug addiction around, especially on the eastern side where dollarama is located. It’s really sad, Wish the city would do more to help these poor souls.
Lots of facilities but areas a little colourful if not used to it

We didn't really use the park, we used the tennis courts and it was great. There are only 2 courts but we didn't have to wait since only one was being used by another couple. They are clean and well maintained. We are definitely going back there at least two times per week.

323.name: The Toronto Inukshuk Park
323.formatted_address: 789 Lake Shore Blvd W, Toronto, ON M5V 3T7, Canada
reviews: This is not really a park. There is an inukshuk here and green space. Maybe some seating options if you sit on the rocks. This "park" is more of a connection between Coronation Park and Trillium Park. There is also a path to take you to the trail that runs alongside Lake Shore Blvd West.

If you are looking for a park with a playground, this is not the place to go. However, it does have a very large and cool looking Inukshuk for photos. The stones around the Inukshuk are engraved, which provides additional information. I suggest walking the waterfront trail.
A nice park for walking / biking while enjoying the Toronto skyline views. Cool place to take some photographs as well. The inukshuk here is known to be one of the largest of its kind.
Beautiful lake views and nice points to take pictures.

If you travel around northern #Canada, #Alaska, or even #Greenland, you may spot large rock formations towering over the landscape, resembling the shape of a person with arms stretching out. They are called #Inukshuk.  Inukshuk, a structure made of stones piled on top of each other, was used for navigation in the frozen north where, in the snow of Tundra, everything could look the same.  Peoples of the #Arctic use them to mark hunting grounds for #caribou, #seal, #walrus, #whale or landing sites for boats and kayaks or to warn travellers of dangerous currents beneath the ice.  #Inuksuit are also sacred to the #native peoples. Many #Inuit retain strong attachments to inuksuit believed to have been built by their ancestors. Evidence shows this tradition is as old as 9000 years.  And, some of these landmarks have been standing for 2000 years.  Traditionally constructed by the Inuit, Inuksuit are often intertwined with representations of Canada and #theNorth.  #Indigenous #NativeAmerican #Iñupiat, #Kalaallit, #Yupik,  #NorthernCanada, #Greenland, #Alaska #Inunnguaq #Tundra

324.name: Coronation Park
324.formatted_address: 711 Lake Shore Blvd W, Toronto, ON M5V 3T7, Canada
reviews: In the heart of Downtown Toronto, this amazing patch of green brings a breath of cool fresh air to all residents and visitors. You can play, walk, sit and relax, picnic with friends and family. It offers the shade of beautiful old trees and soft grass below your feet. Enjoy the best of nature close to home.

Very interesting history of this park, apparently it's on the reclaimed land when the workers didn't have had any work.. Trees are also planted by veteran's and it has memorials too.. a good place and a good combination of lake front, baseball ground, cycle tracks and so on.

Beautiful park! Many amazing views of the city skyline. Very family friendly and a great spot to do an evening stroll and unwind. Always very clean and well cared for as well. Make sure you do the whole trail around the cinesphere. Tons to see!
So many beautiful mature Oak trees for shade. Lots of Sun too. I do my yoga here. Clean washrooms nearby. Lots of personal space in a public park.
Great place for a morning run. Calm and serene. View of the lake and the yachts/ small boats along the harbour line is great.

editorial_summary.overview: Lakefront park & picnic spot featuring multiple baseball diamonds & an off-leash dog area.

325.name: Trinity Bellwoods Park
325.formatted_address: 790 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1G3, Canada
reviews: Spacious park with plenty of greenspace, a baseball diamond, 8 public tennis courts, and splash pad. Public toilets available but are quite dirty and run down. However, great park overall to lounge in the sun or shade. Often will find merchants selling picnic blankets and other second hand items. Plenty of cycling room.

Had the most amazing time here. So many people were with family having a picnic, some were dancing with friends. Beautiful sakura flowers/cherry blossoms at this time of the year but the highlight was the sunset at the dog's pit. Nearby places for coffee and food are really great too.

One of the best and the biggest park in Downtown. This is a good time to go the park to enjoy some cherry blossoms. The park also has tennis court, skate boarding space and some beautiful views. It is also a great place for picnic.
The park is vibrant and clean.  There is a diversity of people and of activities you can do there.  I go the for tennis, the courts are well maintained.

Nice place to chill out in Toronto, but crowded on weekends. I dint got much time to explore the whole park but you can still find good decent place to hang around with friends and enjoy your weekend with peace. Dogs are allowed and be careful if you don't like them bcoz there will be always around with owners. A good picnic stop within the town. Parking is paid on streets and if you take a trnaist do not take form Ossinigton since it's crowded on weekends and frequent is very bad. You may need to walk to nearest station that is whatbi did Fter waiting for a bus for almost 1/2hr

editorial_summary.overview: Spacious park with volleyball & tennis courts, an outdoor skating rink & indoor recreation centre.

326.name: Acqua Dolce Supper Club & Entertainment Venue
326.formatted_address: 50 Prince Edward Island Crescent, Toronto, ON M6K 3C3, Canada
reviews: Nice place for some decent Italian food at a good price point. Really good portions as well.  Went here for dinner with one of my girlfriends on Friday after work. The location of the place isn’t the most convenient, and kind of out of the way unless you drive. The restaurant has a paid green p parking lot for those are are driving there. The restaurant was quite empty when we came to dine, maybe because it’s next to the exhibition place so I’d imagine it’d be more quaint during the winter and probably has more traffic in the summer when the exhibition place is occupied.  When we arrived at the restaurant, there was no hostess or anyone to seat us, maybe because they weren’t busy so they didn’t have many staff working. We seated ourselves since it was taking a bit. Once we sat down though, someone came to us with the menu and took our order in a timely manner. The menu options were small but well priced and food portions were big (I couldn’t finish my food). The food was delicious and service throughout dinner was good. We also received complimentary dessert toward the end of our meal, which was a nice touch.  The decor for the place was really nice, very upscale vibes. Definitely a good space for hosting events as well.  I would come back to this place again if I’m looking for a hearty portion of Italian food for a cheap price. Maybe in the summer, since they have a really nice patio but unfortunately we couldn’t check it out this time because it’s winter.

We went here for Dinner and were very pleases.  The restaurant aesthetically was very nice. Clean and neat. The curved feature wall starting from the bar was beautiful.  We sat at a booth right by the large windows looking over Lake Ontario and CNE gardens. I could see this place being even nicer in the summer.  The service was great. Our waiter was polite and good with our kids.  We had a couple apps to start and then had 3 of the 4 of us get pizza and one get the steak. We were all.pleased as all.our plates were empty when we were done.  The wood oven pizza's were the perfect size and tasty.  We found this place as we were looking for a nice restaurant near Ontario Place because we were going to the Cirque Du Soleil. This restaurant was perfect for that as it was a 10 minute walk.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice Italian meal. We need to get this place put on the map because unfortunately due to where it is you really need to know that it is there because there is really no foot traffic or even car traffic.  It is literally connected to the back side of  the Bandshell on the CNE grounds.  I understand they even do events like wedding and stuff. I could see this a great place for a small intimate gatherings.  Oh and the Paper Plane cocktail was great too!  Thank you Acqua Dolce for a nice meal.  Would definitely come back!!!  Cheers!!

This place was amazing! We went here before going to a Zac Brown Band concert. It was a very short walk from the Budweiser stadium!  The only thing that sucks for them is there isn’t much foot or car traffic. There really was only one other group that walked in when we were dinning! It’s honestly a hidden beauty! I definitely recommend going if you’re ever looking for a delicious authentic italien meal!  Food: everything we ordered was delicious and Homemade. No food was left on the plates! We ordered some pizzas, gnocchi and spaghetti which were all good! The best thing was the pizza « Porri E Pancetta ». We easily agreed this was in fact the best flat bread pizza we had ever eaten!  We got some free chocolates while leaving and let me tell you they were amazing! And like everything else on the menu they were homemade.  Service: first off the staff was nothing but welcoming! We loved to chat with them as we were the only ones there. They were very quick. Our food was on the table within 15mins! And we ordered 6 things as we are a family of five and had to taste at least one appetizer! Overall amazing staff and service!  Atmosphere: This place is beautiful! With the amazing decor and amazing view! I love the beautiful red piano and all the wood designs! There was great little music in the background! And very comfy booths😂  Prices: everything was reasonably priced! And all worth the amount paid!  Thank you Acqua Dolce for the amazing night!
Absolutely delicious pasta! Would definitely dine here again. It's also super close to Budweiser Stage and BMO Field. Service was excellent!

Had an amazing experience here last night before going to TIFF. Beautiful restaurant with kind hearted staff. I had called the restaurant before arriving asking about parking. They mentioned they had a small lot just for guests so that’s where we parked. After dinner we came out to get in our cars and were greeted by city parking authority ticketing our vehicles with absolutely no right to do so. After arguing with the security for over 10 minutes, Amelia (I believe the chef) came out to deal with our situation promptly. She turned our night around and made sure we didn’t leave with tickets. We were blown away with her hospitality and kindness. Thank you Amelia! We will be back.

editorial_summary.overview: Chic place on the Exhibition Grounds, with a high-end eclectic menu & a patio with lakefront views.

327.name: Liberty Village Park
327.formatted_address: 70 E Liberty St, Toronto, ON M6K 3K7, Canada
reviews: A much needed break from the surrounding condominium farm. It's a nice little park. Usually many dogs, as it has a wide open area. Nice spot for kids to run around too. Many amenities nearby.
Good place tô go with children and dogs
30 Year Inglis reunion. A group of people stood in the rain for a photo. It was a great time!
Great little park.  There’s a geocache there too if you can find it.
Liberty village is beatifull full off restaurant  shopping fresh Brad its beatifull

328.name: CondoDoggy
328.formatted_address: 12 Sudbury St, Toronto, ON M6J 3W7, Canada
reviews: Barb walked our dog Alistair for several years while we lived in the Queen West area. Ali absolutely loved her, and couldn't have been more excited to go out with her on an almost daily basis. Barb was always reliable, communicative and clearly loved Ali and all of her "clients" very much. We'd recommend Barb to anyone looking for a solid dog walker in the area.

Barb is absolutely fantastic. Our dog Storm loves her so much. We know Storm's daily highlight is her walk and trip to the park with Barb. Barb treats Storm with so much care, love and attention! She always lets us know of any concerns or issues. Barb is wonderful to work with. Highly professional, always quick to respond and flexible with our schedules. We recommend Barb to walk anyone and everyone's dog! -Dan, Katie, and Storm

Our dog has been walked by Barbara @condodoggy since we brought her home as a rescue. She has had a couple of behavioral issues so Barbara suggested a solo walks first to work them out. It went beautifully and after of couple of weeks she could join her group. Unfortunately we had to sell our condo at the KIng West neighbourhood. We will continue to be consistent with her +R approach and we wish her all the best. Keep your high standards Barb!
Barb is a great dog walker. She is very caring and attentive with my pup. Could not recommend her more.
Barb and her husband are superb. I wouldnt want anyone else to walk my dog

329.name: Alison Unleashed Downtown
329.formatted_address: 125 Blue Jays Way, Toronto, ON M5V 0N5, Canada
reviews: Alison has been our dog walker for the last three months and we can’t imagine our life before her. She is so wonderful with our dog Capone. She communicates frequently, sending many pictures, videos and comments throughout every walk as well as letting us know once he is picked up and dropped off. She is extremely accommodating as well, flexible with us as we have evolving needs. She has helped our dog immensely become a better walker and overall better trained. Our dog is excited to see her everyday and loves his walks with her and his pack of friends.

My dog has been looked after by Alison and her amazing staff for years. They are all dog lovers and take such fantastic care of my fur baby. He has stayed at Alison's numerous times when I have gone away and has thoroughly enjoyed himself on her couch! He certainly feels at home there and my mind is always at ease knowing that he is being cared for and loved. He goes on group outings twice per week and has a blast with his doggie friends. I can't say enough good things about these wonderful, compassionate people. I am so grateful to have them in our lives.

Our 2 year-old, super high-energy Husky-shepherd cross has been attending doggy day care at Alison's for over 1.5 years. Hands-down, Alison is the absolute BEST in the industry!  We have employed other name-brand commercial establishments in the past, but they all pale in comparison to the personal, intimate, hands-on, outdoor,  social experience every canine deserves, desires, and experiences while in Alison's care. The other dogs are well-vetted; all dogs are excercised daily (at length) at a free-run local farm and/or leash-free dogparks; and taken on leashed walks rain, snow, or shine!!! Alison also adheres to any dietary restrictions outlined during her intake meeting. We receive almost hourly updates of photos and videos of our happy pup as he runs, swims, and naps with his friends, all under the direct care and supervision of Alison et al. I 100% recommend Alison Unleashed to everyone I meet as she is trusted, personable, reliable, and has a deep personal connection with all of the dogs she cares for. Alison has become a part of our family, and as shift workers, we can not begin to express our gratitude to her. Alison has gone above and beyond for our pup and we guarantee she will do the same for yours.

Alison has provided wonderful care to our dogs, Jewel & Teddy and our cats Patches & Cleo over the years when we have been away. We have had pets with special health needs and it has been comforting to know that they are in good hands while we are on vacation. She went above and beyond, taking our kitty to her house for visits, so she would have company for a time each day.  Alison is reliable and professional. We would highly recommend her to anyone who is looking for a caring and dependable person to help care for their pets.

I recently got a cockapoo puppy and I am SO pleased that I decided to go with Alison to board my puppy with. I contacted a few kennels and boarding facilities in the Hamilton and Burlington area, and after meeting with a few, I decided to go with Alison. Within a few minutes of meeting with her, you could tell that she is passionate about animals. I left my little Brodi with Alison for 4 days and within those days, I received regular picture/video text messages to help put me at ease while I was away travelling for work. Since he is a puppy, Alison was very attentive to his needs and even helped me to continue with his training while I was away. I travel quite often for work and I will be using Alison's boarding services from now on for my little Brodi. Amazing service and amazing experience!

330.name: Toronto Music Garden
330.formatted_address: 479 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5V 3M8, Canada
reviews: Beautiful garden at the core of the waterfront along the banks of Lake Ontario. It's got exhilaration boardwalks and trails accessible throughout the day/night/year. The summers are amazing with live music played. Good for family friends and your pet to walk and relax. Accessible by walking and street cars. I would highly recommend this place to relax and have fun.
